      "sfanswerc" : "<p>A typical <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_language_processing\" target=\"_blank\">Natural Language Processing </a>(NLP) will extract terms based on linguistic rules and/or frequency of words alone.</p>\n\n<p>Coveo’s approach is different,  in addition to traditional NLP methods, it leverages the vocabulary used by past users when they searched for content. This provides a more accurate picture of what is relevant to users in this context. </p>\n\n<p>Usually, a query contains an average of 4 words, which is relatively simple to manage.  However, new use cases have shown demand for using paragraph size text as input queries, such as using the description of a support case to help agents find a solution more efficiently.  But, the query management algorithm is not designed to deal with that many words.  Therefore, Coveo ML now provides the new <a href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/SalesforceV2/Activating+Machine+Learning+Intelligent+Term+Detection+%28ITD%29+in+Salesforce\" target=\"_blank\">Intelligent Term Detection</a> (ITD) algorithm, which uses machine learning to determine which words, from the whole text, are the most relevant.  </p>\n\n<p>To do so, the ITD algorithm uses the set of past events (search, click, pageviews), from the search interface.  It selects which queries were successful and generated a positive outcome (clicks). It finds a correlation between theses successful queries and the words contained in the long queries. It aims to find the 5 most relevant terms and rank each of them with weighted value.  These 5 terms, are called the “<i>Refined Query</i>”.  It is the Refined Query that is used by the search algorithm to find the most relevant document from the Coveo Index.</p>",

Machine.</p>\\n\\t</li><li>Tout \\u201cWebhook\\u201d configur\\u00e9 en utilisant nos pages de statut (<a href=\\\"http://status.coveo.com/\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">v1</a>, <a href=\\\"http://status.cloud.coveo.com/\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">v2</a>), car celles-ci sont h\\u00e9berg\\u00e9es par une tierce partie</li></ul>\\n\\n<h1><br>Ce qui SERA affect\\u00e9 suite \\u00e0 la d\\u00e9sactivation de TLS 1.0</h1>\\n\\n<table border=\\\"1\\\"><tbody><tr><td colspan=\\\"1\\\" rowspan=\\\"1\\\"><b>Sc\\u00e9nario 1</b></td><td colspan=\\\"1\\\" rowspan=\\\"1\\\">Les impl\\u00e9mentations utilisant le framework d\\u2019interface utilisateur JavaScript de Coveo (ou tout autre composant bas\\u00e9 sur le framework, tel que les panneaux de recommandations) qui se connectent \\u00e0 Plate-forme Coveo Cloud et sont: 1) de mani\\u00e8re g\\u00e9n\\u00e9rale, <b>int\\u00e9gr\\u00e9s sur des sites h\\u00e9berg\\u00e9s sur un serveur web \\u201cfront-end\\u201d (client)</b> n\\u2019ayant pas \\u00e9t\\u00e9 mis \\u00e0 jour pour utiliser TLS 1.1/1.2, ou 2) sp\\u00e9cifiquement, tout composant du serveur de l\\u2019application n\\u00e9cessitant une connexion vers la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud.</td></tr><tr><td colspan=\\\"1\\\" rowspan=\\\"1\\\"><b>Sc\\u00e9nario 2</b></td><td colspan=\\\"1\\\" rowspan=\\\"1\\\"><b>Tout script, service ou application sur mesure </b>ayant \\u00e9t\\u00e9 d\\u00e9velopp\\u00e9 par vous-m\\u00eame, un int\\u00e9grateur syst\\u00e8me ou par les services professionnels de Coveo, se connectant \\u00e0 la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud \\u00e0 partir d\\u2019un serveur n\\u2019ayant pas \\u00e9t\\u00e9 mis \\u00e0 jour pour utiliser TLS 1.1/1.2</td></tr><tr><td colspan=\\\"1\\\" rowspan=\\\"1\\\"><b>Sc\\u00e9nario 3</b></td><td colspan=\\\"1\\\" rowspan=\\\"1\\\"><b>Les installations locales de la solution de recherche pour entreprises de Coveo (CES) utilisant une configuration hybride</b> se connectant \\u00e0 2016 (3.0.1226) sans le module additionnel offrant la compatibilit\\u00e9 TLS 1.2</b>. Ce sc\\u00e9nario peut aussi inclure l\\u2019usage de l\\u2019analyse d&#39;utilisation sur la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud V1 avec une installation locale de Coveo pour Sitecore.</td></tr></tbody></table>\\n\\n<h1><br>Ce qui doit \\u00eatre fait avant que TLS 1.0 ne soit d\\u00e9sactiv\\u00e9</h1>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b>NB:</b> Il est important de consid\\u00e9rer tout pare-feu, proxy ou passerelle interm\\u00e9diaire dans votre infrastructure qui se situe entre la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud et le serveur d\\u00e9crit dans chaque sc\\u00e9nario. Nous vous recommandons de consulter votre \\u00e9quipe de r\\u00e9seautique au besoin.</p>\\n\\n<table border=\\\"1\\\"><tbody><tr><td colspan=\\\"1\\\" rowspan=\\\"1\\\"><b>Sc\\u00e9nario serveur web \\u201cfront-end\\u201d (client)  n\\u2019ayant pas \\u00e9t\\u00e9 mis \\u00e0 jour pour utiliser TLS 1.1/1.2, ou 2) sp\\u00e9cifiquement, tout composant du serveur de l\\u2019application       "sfdetailsc" : "En vertu de la décision prise par le Conseil des normes de sécurité PCI de désactiver le protocole TLS 1.0, Coveo va bientôt désactiver toute connection TLS 1.0 vers sa Plate-forme Cloud.<br><br>Les Plates-formes v1 et v2 seront affectées.<br><br>Cet article a pour buts de 1) vous aider à déterminer si ce changement vous affectera et 2) vous fournir un plan d’action général pour prévenir des impacts potentiels.<br><br><b>Date Prévue:</b>  26 Mars 2018\n<h1><br>Ce qui ne sera PAS affecté suite à la désactivation de TLS 1.0</h1>\n\n<ul><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\">Coveo pour Salesforce, incluant l’intégration dans les Communautés, car la connexion passe par l’infrastructure de Salesforce qui se conforme à TLS 1.1+.</p>\n\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\">Tout service de base Coveo Cloud: Indexation, Recherche, Analyse d’Utilisation, Apprentissage Machine.</p>\n\t</li><li>Tout “Webhook” configuré en utilisant nos pages de statut (<a href=\"http://status.coveo.com/\" target=\"_blank\">v1</a>, <a href=\"http://status.cloud.coveo.com/\" target=\"_blank\">v2</a>), car celles-ci sont hébergées par une tierce partie</li></ul>\n\n<h1><br>Ce qui SERA affecté suite à la désactivation de TLS 1.0</h1>\n\n<table border=\"1\"><tbody><tr><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Scénario 1</b></td><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\">Les implémentations utilisant le framework d’interface utilisateur JavaScript de Coveo (ou tout autre composant basé sur le framework, tel que les panneaux de recommandations) qui se connectent à Plate-forme Coveo Cloud et sont: 1) de manière générale, <b>intégrés sur des sites hébergés sur un serveur web “front-end” (client)</b> n’ayant pas été mis à jour pour utiliser TLS 1.1/1.2, ou 2) spécifiquement, tout composant du serveur de l’application nécessitant une connexion vers la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud.</td></tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Scénario 2</b></td><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Tout script, service ou application sur mesure </b>ayant été développé par vous-même, un intégrateur système ou par les services professionnels de Coveo, se connectant à la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud à partir d’un serveur n’ayant pas été mis à jour pour utiliser TLS 1.1/1.2</td></tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Scénario 3</b></td><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Les installations locales de la solution de recherche pour entreprises de Coveo (CES) utilisant une configuration hybride</b> se connectant à la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud et/ou aux API(s) d’Analyse d’Utilisation à partir d’un serveur n’ayant pas été mis à jour pour utiliser TLS 1.1/1.2</td></tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Scénario 4</b></td><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Coveo pour Sitecore 3.0 Février 2015 (3.0.955) à Janvier 2016 (3.0.1226) sans le module additionnel offrant la compatibilité TLS 1.2</b>. Ce scénario peut aussi inclure l’usage de l’analyse d&#39;utilisation sur la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud V1 avec une installation locale de Coveo pour Sitecore.</td></tr></tbody></table>\n\n<h1><br>Ce qui doit être fait avant que TLS 1.0 ne soit désactivé</h1>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b>NB:</b> Il est important de considérer tout pare-feu, proxy ou passerelle intermédiaire dans votre infrastructure qui se situe entre la Plate-forme Coveo Cloud et le serveur décrit dans chaque scénario. Nous vous recommandons de consulter votre équipe de réseautique au besoin.</p>\n\n<table border=\"1\"><tbody><tr><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Scénario 1</b></td><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\">Mettre à jour le serveur web “front-end” (client) afin d’utiliser les protocoles TLS 1.1/1.2</td></tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Scénario 2</b></td><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\">Mettre à jour le serveur hébergeant votre script/service/application afin d’utiliser les protocoles TLS 1.1/1.2</td></tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Scénario 3</b></td><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\">Mettre à jour le serveur hébergeant la solution de recherche pour entreprises de Coveo (CES) afin d’utiliser les protocoles TLS 1.1/1.2</td></tr><tr><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\"><b>Scénario 4</b></td><td colspan=\"1\" rowspan=\"1\">Suivez les instructions de <a href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/pages/releaseview.action?pageId=34243186\" target=\"_blank\">l&#39;article sur la communauté Coveo</a> afin d’installer le module additionnel qui permet l’utilisation des protocoles TLS 1.1/1.2</td></tr></tbody></table>\n \n\n<h4 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-1dbc03e9-6bf4-2976-917a-18a779f069f9\">Références</b></h4>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><a href=\"https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn786418(v=ws.11).aspx\" target=\"_blank\">TLS/SSL Settings on Windows</a><br><a href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-ca/help/3140245/update-to-enable-tls-1-1-and-tls-1-2-as-a-default-secure-protocols-in\" target=\"_blank\">Update to enable TLS 1.1 and TLS 1.2 as a default secure protocols in WinHTTP in Windows</a><br><a href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/pages/releaseview.action?pageId=34898464\" target=\"_blank\">Coveo for Sitecore 4 SSL/TLS Support</a><br><a href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/pages/releaseview.action?pageId=34243186\" target=\"_blank\">Coveo for Sitecore 3 SSL/TLS Support</a></p>",

[\"000002317\"], \"sfdetailsc\": [\"The query which a user enters in a Coveo search box is applied primarily against the body content of the documents in the index. \\u00a0If there are metadata fields associated with a document type which is not mapped into the body content, the content of those fields will only be considered\\u00a0against a basic search box query if the &quot;Free Text Search&quot; is enabled on that field.<br><br>Some fields such as <b>title</b> and <b>clickableuri\\u00a0</b>have the &quot;Free Text Search&quot; enabled by default. \\u00a0Others, such as the name of an\\u00a0author of a\\u00a0Salesforce\\u00a0Knowledge Article\\u00a0(<b>sfauthorname</b>)\\u00a0do not. \\u00a0One option is if you want the field to be visible in the quickview, mapping a field to the quickview\\u00a0results would add the field to the body content and therefore be included in the basic search. \\u00a0The &quot;Free Text Seach&quot; setting allows the contents of a field to be included in the basic search when looking for matches without it being included in the search results. \\u00a0<br><br><b><span style=\\\"background-color: #FFFF00;\\\">CAUTION</span></b><span style=\\\"background-color: #FFFF00;\\\">:</span>\\u00a0<b> Free Text Search should be enabled with caution as there may be a performance impact on the speed that results are returned.</b><br><br>\\u00a0An example would be if users are searching on the name of a document author, but the results from the search are not returning documents authored by the person in the search. \\u00a0By enabling the Free Text Search on the Author field, a search on a name would return documents authored by that person.<br><br>For administrators on Could\\u00a0V2 versions of Coveo, \\u00a0follow these steps to enable/disable the Free Text Search on a field,\\n<ul><li>Log into the Coveo Administration Console and navigate to Content --&gt; Fields</li></ul>\\n<img </div>       </div>       <div style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;\\\">The query which a user enters in a Coveo search box is applied primarily against the body content of the documents in the index. \\u00a0If there are metadata fields associated with a document type which is not mapped into the body content, the content of those fields will only be considered\\u00a0against field to be visible in the quickview, mapping a field to the quickview\\u00a0results would add the field to the body content and therefore be included in the basic search. \\u00a0The &quot;Free Text Seach&quot; setting allows the contents of a field to be included in the basic search when looking for matches without it being included in the search results. \\u00a0<br><br><b><span style=\\\"background-color: #FFFF00;\\\">CAUTION</span></b><span style=\\\"background-color: #FFFF00;\\\">:</span>\\u00a0<b> Free Text Search should be enabled with caution as there may be a performance impact on the speed that results are returned.</b><br><br>\\u00a0An example would be if users are searching on the name of a document author, but the results from the search are not returning documents authored by the person in the search. \\u00a0By enabling the Free Text Search on the Author field, a search on a name would return documents authored by that person.<br><br>For       "sfdetailsc" : "The query which a user enters in a Coveo search box is applied primarily against the body content of the documents in the index.  If there are metadata fields associated with a document type which is not mapped into the body content, the content of those fields will only be considered against a basic search box query if the &quot;Free Text Search&quot; is enabled on that field.<br><br>Some fields such as <b>title</b> and <b>clickableuri </b>have the &quot;Free Text Search&quot; enabled by default.  Others, such as the name of an author of a Salesforce Knowledge Article (<b>sfauthorname</b>) do not.  One option is if you want the field to be visible in the quickview, mapping a field to the quickview results would add the field to the body content and therefore be included in the basic search.  The &quot;Free Text Seach&quot; setting allows the contents of a field to be included in the basic search when looking for matches without it being included in the search results.  <br><br><b><span style=\"background-color: #FFFF00;\">CAUTION</span></b><span style=\"background-color: #FFFF00;\">:</span> <b> Free Text Search should be enabled with caution as there may be a performance impact on the speed that results are returned.</b><br><br> An example would be if users are searching on the name of a document author, but the results from the search are not returning documents authored by the person in the search.  By enabling the Free Text Search on the Author field, a search on a name would return documents authored by that person.<br><br>For administrators on Could V2 versions of Coveo,  follow these steps to enable/disable the Free Text Search on a field,\n<ul><li>Log into the Coveo Administration Console and navigate to Content --&gt; Fields</li></ul>\n<img alt=\"Salesforce Knowledge Author Field\" height=\"132\" src=\"https://c.na61.content.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka032000000XjUC&amp;feoid=00N32000002jMQL&amp;refid=0EM32000000cAxw\" width=\"500\"></img> \n<ul><li>View the field you are interested in and click on the Advanced Settings</li><li>Move the toggle to enable or disable Free Text Search</li></ul>\n<img alt=\"Enable Free Text Search\" height=\"263\" src=\"https://c.na61.content.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka032000000XjUC&amp;feoid=00N32000002jMQL&amp;refid=0EM32000000cAy1\" width=\"500\"></img><br><br><br><b>Note</b>:  Some fields may be locked down and may not be edited.  To work around this, create a custom field and associate it with the content you are wanting to include in the search.<br><br> ",

      "sfinstructionsc" : "<br>You can open a case with Support through the Support Community.  There is a small form to fill out that help us quickly assess the nature of the issue and to prioritize it accordingly.  Also, as you fill out some of the fields in the form you will be presented with possible solutions to your issue.\n<ol><li>Login to <a href=\"https://support.coveo.com/s/\" target=\"_blank\">https://support.coveo.com/s/</a></li><li>Click New Case button in the My Cases widget</li><li>Fill out the fields in the case creation form\n\t<ol><li><b>Product</b> - Select the product that you are using which is experiencing the issue.\n\t\t<ul><li><b>Coveo for Salesforce</b> - Coveo package on the Salesforce AppExchange used for Agent or Community search.</li><li><b>Coveo for Sitecore</b> - Coveo Integration with Sitecore.</li><li><b>Coveo Platform</b> - Coveo&#39;s cloud or on-premise offerings that do not fall into the above 2 categories.</li></ul>\n\t\t</li><li><b>Issue Type</b> - How would you categorize the issue?<span style=\"display: none;\"> </span>\n\t\t<ul><li><b>Search Performance</b> - Are results taking longer than normal to be returned or are they not being returned at all?</li><li><b>Result Relevance</b> - Are the result not relevant to the query?</li><li><b>Security</b> - Are users seeing results that they don&#39;t have access to or has a vulnerability been identified?</li><li><b>Usage Analytics</b> - Are UA events not sent, or are there issues with a dashboard?</li><li><b>UI/UX</b> - Are there problems with styles in the UI or how to brand the UI to fit a certain scheme?</li><li><b>Administration</b> - Is there a problem with the Admin UI or are there issues getting something done from this UI?</li></ul>\n\t\t</li><li><b>Product Context</b> - How is the search interfaced used?\n\t\t<ul><li><b>Support Agent Search</b> - Search used to improve support agent performance.</li><li><b>E-commerce Search</b> - Search used to help clients find products.</li><li><b>Website search</b> - Search used to help users find pages on a web site.</li><li><b>Self-service Search</b> - Search used to help users find solutions to on their own.</li><li><b>Internal/employee Search</b> - Search used in an employee portal to help them find relevant content.</li><li><b>Multiple</b> - Any combination of the above categories.</li></ul>\n\t\t</li><li><b>Affected End-Users</b> - How many end users are experiencing the issue?\n\t\t<ul><li><b>All</b></li><li><b>Majority</b></li><li><b>Minority</b></li><li><b>None</b></li></ul>\n\t\t</li><li><b>System Level</b> - In what environment if the issue found?\n\t\t<ul><li><b>Prod</b></li><li><b>Non-prod</b></li><li><b>Non-prod on a Deadline</b> - Please provide the deadline in the case description</li></ul>\n\t\t</li><li><b>Subject</b>\n\t\t<ul><li>A brief description of the issue.  This will be used to present possible solutions.</li></ul>\n\t\t</li><li><b>Description</b>\n\t\t<ul><li>Here you can provide more details on the issue.  Include error messages, steps to reproduce, org names, and anything else that will help the support team find a solution for you quickly.  The text in the field is also used to present possible solutions.</li></ul>\n\t\t</li></ol>\n\t</li><li>Click Submit.</li></ol>",

\"objecttypelabel\": [\"Best Practice\"], \"kav_articlenumber\": [\"000002204\"], \"sfdetailsc\": [\"<p>When performing searches that include a variety of special, non-alphanumeric characters, the results can be inconsistent (either incorrect results lists or no results at all) and cause concern that the search is not working properly.\\u00a0 This is likely occurring because Coveo search is looking at some of special characters as search operators.\\u00a0 These operators allow for complicated, custom searches and include things like commas, parentheses/brackets, etc\\u00a0\\u00a0 See https://onlinehelp.coveo.com/en/ces/7.0/user/coveo_query_syntax_reference.htm for a details and other links on query syntax including special characters.<br>\\u00a0<br>The option to use special characters in a search is an all or nothing proposition.\\u00a0 It can be turned off so that all characters are treated as searchable items but this removes\\u00a0the ability to use even the basic, common search operators which can help in effective searching therefore most systems have this option enabled.\\u00a0 So what to do if your search string includes many special characters and the results are not matching expections?<br>\\u00a0<br>Enclose the search string with the special characters in double-quotes to force an exact match.\\u00a0 If this doesn\\u2019t return the desired results due to some variants in the strings within the searched content, then pare the search string down to smaller, more common elements still using the double quotes around all or parts of the query and retry.\\u00a0<br><br>Here is an example of a search string that failed to provide any results and two options to address it (modified parts in bold italics for readability)<br><br><u><b>Initial Search string:</b></u></p>\\n\\n<p><br>operation on remote machine on password object safe: &lt;safe&gt;, folder: &lt;folder&gt;,object: &lt;object&gt; failed (try #x) with the following error: error in changepass to user &lt;user&gt; on domain &lt;domain&gt; (\\\\\\\\domain). (winrc=2245) the password does not meet the password policy requirements. check the minimum password length, password complexity and password history requirements.<br>\\u00a0<br><u><b>Revised Search String (enclosed in Double-Quotes):</b></u></p>\\n\\n<p><br><i><b>\\u201coperation on remote machine on password object safe: &lt;safe&gt;, folder: &lt;folder&gt;,object: &lt;object&gt; failed (try #x) with the following error: error in changepass to user &lt;user&gt; on domain &lt;domain&gt; (\\\\\\\\domain).       "sfdcexpandedproduct" : "All;All|.NET Search Interface;All|Coveo Enterprise Search;All|Javascript Search Interface",
      "sfdetailsc" : "<p>When performing searches that include a variety of special, non-alphanumeric characters, the results can be inconsistent (either incorrect results lists or no results at all) and cause concern that the search is not working properly.  This is likely occurring because Coveo search is looking at some of special characters as search operators.  These operators allow for complicated, custom searches and include things like commas, parentheses/brackets, etc   See https://onlinehelp.coveo.com/en/ces/7.0/user/coveo_query_syntax_reference.htm for a details and other links on query syntax including special characters.<br> <br>The option to use special characters in a search is an all or nothing proposition.  It can be turned off so that all characters are treated as searchable items but this removes the ability to use even the basic, common search operators which can help in effective searching therefore most systems have this option enabled.  So what to do if your search string includes many special characters and the results are not matching expections?<br> <br>Enclose the search string with the special characters in double-quotes to force an exact match.  If this doesn’t return the desired results due to some variants in the strings within the searched content, then pare the search string down to smaller, more common elements still using the double quotes around all or parts of the query and retry. <br><br>Here is an example of a search string that failed to provide any results and two options to address it (modified parts in bold italics for readability)<br><br><u><b>Initial Search string:</b></u></p>\n\n<p><br>operation on remote machine on password object safe: &lt;safe&gt;, folder: &lt;folder&gt;,object: &lt;object&gt; failed (try #x) with the following error: error in changepass to user &lt;user&gt; on domain &lt;domain&gt; (\\\\domain). (winrc=2245) the password does not meet the password policy requirements. check the minimum password length, password complexity and password history requirements.<br> <br><u><b>Revised Search String (enclosed in Double-Quotes):</b></u></p>\n\n<p><br><i><b>“operation on remote machine on password object safe: &lt;safe&gt;, folder: &lt;folder&gt;,object: &lt;object&gt; failed (try #x) with the following error: error in changepass to user &lt;user&gt; on domain &lt;domain&gt; (\\\\domain). (winrc=2245) the password does not meet the password policy requirements. check the minimum password length, password complexity and password history requirements</b></i>.”<br> <br><u><b>Revised Search String (only special character substrings enclosed in Double-Quotes):</b></u><br> <br>operation on remote machine on password object “<i><b>safe: &lt;safe&gt;, folder: &lt;folder&gt;,object: &lt;object&gt; failed (try #x) with the following error: error in changepass to user &lt;user&gt; on domain &lt;domain&gt; (\\\\domain). (winrc=2245)</b></i>” the password does not meet the password policy requirements. check the minimum password length, password complexity and password history requirements.</p>",

      "sfresolutionc" : "To do so: <br><br>1 - Follow this documentation to enable the query profiling (https://onlinehelp.coveo.com/en/ces/7.0/administrator/using_query_profiling.htm) <br>2 - Perform a few queries on your search page <br>3 - Disable query profiling following the documentation (https://onlinehelp.coveo.com/en/ces/7.0/administrator/using_query_profiling.htm) <br>4 - Open the CESProfiling-SliceQuery log in CES7\\Index\\Default\\Default\\Profiling <br><br>This log will contain two important information. <br><br>TotalQueryTime: The total time a query took <br>ExecuteQuery &gt; ExecuteRankingModifiers: How much of that total time was used by the qre. <br><br>By comparing these two numbers, you will be able to measure if your qre add a lot to the total query time or not. This will therefore give you a great tool to determine if you can add new expression or maybe optimize your current one. <br><br>In resume, you can add as many boosting expression that you want to your Coveo for Sitecore search page and you need to be aware that this might impact the speed of your queries if you add to many of them. If in the process of adding new boosting rule, you come to realize that the performance of your search is lowered, I invite you to perform a quick analysis of the query profiling logs to find out if it&#39;s linked to your boosting rules (also known as qre). ",

Description         </div>       </div>       <div style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;\\\"> <a href=\\\"https://onlinehelp.coveo.com/en/ces/7.0/administrator/what_are_query_ranking_expressions.htm\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Query Ranking Expression</a> are a powerful tool that allows you to customize your Coveo Search, notably by allowing you to create boosting rules to affect the qeury ranking.<br><br>There is no limit to the number of boosting rules you can implement in your Coveo Search page per say. Therefore, you can add as many expression as you want. Doing so however may impact performance of your queries because boosting rules creates what&#39;s called a qre, or query ranking expression.\\u00a0<br><br>Thus, depending on the number and complexity of your qre, it may affect what we call the query time, the time a query take to be processed by the CES Index. Obviously, it&#39;s always best to have the lowest query time as possible.\\u00a0<br><br>Also, there&#39;s no rule of thumb that would allow one to determine if a single or a group of qre will affect query time, a priori at least.\\u00a0<br><br>However, what can be done is to measure the impact of a new qre on the query time. This article explains how to do it.</div>       <div style=\\\"font-size: 1.5em;font-weight: 600;Padding-top: 30px;border-bottom: 1px solid #BBC5CC;\\\">         <div style=\\\"border-left: 1px solid 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;\\\"> To do so:\\u00a0<br><br>1 - Follow this documentation to enable the query profiling (https://onlinehelp.coveo.com/en/ces/7.0/administrator/using_query_profiling.htm)\\u00a0<br>2 - Perform a few queries on your search page\\u00a0<br>3 - Disable query profiling following the documentation (https://onlinehelp.coveo.com/en/ces/7.0/administrator/using_query_profiling.htm)\\u00a0<br>4 - Open the CESProfiling-SliceQuery log in CES7\\\\Index\\\\Default\\\\Default\\\\Profiling\\u00a0<br><br>This log will contain two important information.\\u00a0<br><br>TotalQueryTime: The total time a query took\\u00a0<br>ExecuteQuery &gt; ExecuteRankingModifiers: How much of that total time was used by the qre.\\u00a0<br><br>By comparing these two numbers, you will be able to measure if your qre add a lot to the total query time or not. This will therefore give you a great tool to determine if you can add new expression or maybe optimize your current one.\\u00a0<br><br>In resume, you can add as many boosting expression that you want to your Coveo for Sitecore search page and you need to be aware that this might impact the speed of your queries if you add to many of them. If in the process of adding new boosting rule, you come to realize that the performance of your search is lowered, I invite you to perform a quick analysis of the query profiling logs to find out if it&#39;s linked to your boosting rules (also known as qre).\\u00a0</div>     </div>   </body> </html>\"], \"kav_product__c\": [\"Coveo Enterprise Search\"], \"kav_article_type__c\": [\"How To\"], \"sfpublishstatus\": [\"Online\"], \"sfcreatedbyid\": [\"00560000003q7JgAAI\"], \"kav_description__c__html_stripped\": [\"Query Ranking Expression  are a powerful tool that allows you to customize your Coveo Search, notably by allowing you to create boosting rules to affect the qeury ranking. \\n \\n There is no limit to the number of boosting rules you can implement in your Coveo Search page per say. Therefore, you can add as many expression as you want. Doing so however may impact performance of your queries because boosting rules creates what's called a qre, or query ranking expression.\\u00a0 \\n \\n Thus, depending on the number and complexity of your qre, it may affect what we call the query time, the time a query take to be processed by the CES Index. Obviously, it's always best to have the lowest query time as possible.\\u00a0 \\n \\n Also, there's no rule of thumb that would allow one to determine if a single or a group of qre will affect query time, a priori at least.\\u00a0 \\n \\n However, what can be done is to measure the impact of a new qre on the query time. On your CES Server, open a CES Console<br>2 - In IIS Manager, launch the recycling of the Sitecore AppPool\\u00a0<br>3 - As an anonymous user, immediately log in on any page that uses the ContentSearchManager.GetIndex() method<br>4 - With that anonymous user, make a query from your search page. All the basic events that are required for the search are already provided.<br><br>Here is the starter guide for <a href=\\\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/JsSearchV1/JavaScript+Search+Framework+Getting+Started+Tutorial\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">JSUI</a>.<br>Once you understand the principle of it you can easily remove the unnecessary component for your integration,\\u00a0add one that you would need or even create a new one.<br><br>Be very careful, using the standalone JSUI does require the use of <a href=\\\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/CloudPlatform/API+Key+Authentication\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">API key</a> and without the use of a <a href=\\\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/CloudPlatform/Search+Token+Authentication\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">back-end to encrypt those key</a> some malevolent people could use those easily. All the basic events that are required for the search are already provided.<br><br>Here is the starter guide for <a href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/JsSearchV1/JavaScript+Search+Framework+Getting+Started+Tutorial\" target=\"_blank\">JSUI</a>.<br>Once you understand the principle of it you can easily remove the unnecessary component for your integration, add one that you would need or even create a new one.<br><br>Be very careful, using the standalone JSUI does require the use of <a href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/CloudPlatform/API+Key+Authentication\" target=\"_blank\">API key</a> and without the use of a <a href=\"https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/CloudPlatform/Search+Token+Authentication\" target=\"_blank\">back-end to encrypt those key</a> some malevolent people could use those easily.       "sfdetailsc" : "I have noticed that there is an option to View an On-Demand Recording for the purchased training classes offered on the <a href=\"https://www.coveo.com/en/services/training\" target=\"_blank\">Coveo Training Page</a>.<br>How does this work?<br><br>Each class selected from the main page and contains a &quot;View On-Demand Recording&quot; button underneath the View Schedule and View How to Register buttons.<br><img alt=\"View On-Demand\" src=\"https://c.na61.content.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka00d0000009kwq&amp;feoid=00N32000002jMQL&amp;refid=0EM0d00000025W6\"></img><br><br>Selecting &quot;View On-Demand Recording&quot; takes you to a catalog of courses that are available as <a href=\"https://attendee.gototraining.com/87n2t/catalog/6774909563415537920\" target=\"_blank\">on-demand recordings</a>.<br><br>The process is as follows:<br><br>1.    Go to the <a href=\"http://www.coveo.com/en/services/training\" target=\"_blank\">Training Page</a> on our website to see a list of all the training offerings and pricing with recommended learning paths by specialty or role.<br>2.    After selecting the individual class you wish to register for which takes you to the detailed page that includes the description and agenda.<br>3.    Select “<a href=\"https://attendee.gototraining.com/87n2t/catalog/6774909563415537920\" target=\"_blank\">View On-Demand Recording</a>” to see the list of courses available.<br>4.    Select the Register <img alt=\"Register\" src=\"https://c.na61.content.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka00d0000009kwq&amp;feoid=00N32000002jMQL&amp;refid=0EM0d00000025WQ\"></img> button for any On-Demand class recordings you are interested in and fill out the registration form with your contact information.  <br>5.    After submitting the registration request, a payment page is presented.  If you have pre-paid training funds, you can close your browser at this point.  If not and you are from the United States, you may pay with a credit card via the PayPal process.<br>6.    Please contact your Customer Success Manager, Client Executive or the <a href=\"mailto: trainingrequest@coveo.com\" target=\"_blank\">Coveo TrainingRequest</a> mailbox for help with purchasing on-demand class recordings.<br>7.    Once you submit your contact information, the Coveo Training team gets a notification and will mark you as paid if you already pre-paid for the training. Once you are marked as paid, an automated email is sent to you that contains a link to join the class and instructions.  (Please allow 24 hours for the automated confirmation email to be sent)  The confirmation email contains a link to join and add the class time to your calendar.<br><br><b>All classes are priced per person.  </b><br><br>Here is a short <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ytckDuszPF0&amp;feature=youtu.be\" target=\"_blank\">video</a> that steps you through the registration process as well.  You can ignore the last step on paying with a credit card if you have pre-paid training funds from a signed PO.<br><br><br>Contact your Customer Success Manager, Client Executive or the <a href=\"mailto: trainingrequest@coveo.com\" target=\"_blank\">Coveo TrainingRequest</a> mailbox for any questions about our training offerings.",

Indeed, other solution like Lucene sees the time needed for a query going up rapidly as the query is getting more and more complex.</span></li></ul>\\n\\u00a0<br><span style=\\\"font-size: 11.0pt;\\\">In addition, if you are using the Coveo Cloud Platform, the infrastructure powering your search experience is managed for you, thus eliminating the added complexity of managing dedicated Coveo machines. </span><br>\\u00a0 \\t\\t\\t</div> \\t\\t</div>  \\t</body> </html>\"], \"sfpublishstatus\": [\"Online\"], \"sfcreatedbyid\": [\"00560000003q7JgAAI\"], \"sfknowledgearticleid\": [\"kA30d0000004SPcCAM\"], \"kav_islatestversion\": [true], \"kav_knowledgearticleid\": [\"kA30d0000004SPcCAM\"], \"kav_answer__c__html_stripped\": [\"What the advantage and inconvenient of having the Indexes outside of Sitecore \\n \\u00a0 \\n Providing with a full list of advantages and inconvenient of the Coveo platform vs other types of solution requires an  \\n What are the pros and cons of having a search index outside of Sitecore \\n \\u00a0 \\n Providing with a full list of pros and cons of the Coveo Platform vs other types of solution requires an extensive comparative analysis between the various features offered by each. If you are interested in this type of discussion, please contact your Coveo Client Executive. \\n \\u00a0 \\n Consequently, I will focus the scope of my answer strictly to the pros and cons of having a cloud index. \\n \\u00a0 \\n Advantages \\n \\u00a0\\n Search is a feature that requires a lot of resources. By having the indexes and the search engine outside of Sitecore, you are reducing the load on the CMs and CDs servers, thus dedicating more resources to the experience of your Visitors.  \\n\\u00a0 \\n \\u00a0 \\n Inconvenients \\n \\u00a0\\n Being a external search engine, it can be a bit slower (in the millisecond range). However, this is not completely true because the Coveo Platform is designed to process very complex query logic very fast. Indeed, other solution like Lucene sees the time needed for a query going up rapidly as the query is getting more and more complex. \\n\\u00a0 \\n In addition, if you are using the Coveo Cloud Platform, the infrastructure powering your search experience is managed for you, thus eliminating the added complexity of managing dedicated Coveo machines.  \\n \\u00a0\"], By having the indexes and the search engine outside of Sitecore, you are reducing the load on the CMs and CDs servers, thus dedicating more resources to the experience of your Visitors. </span></li></ul>\\n\\u00a0<br>\\u00a0<br><b><span style=\\\"font-size: 11.0pt;\\\">Inconvenients</span></b><br>\\u00a0\\n<ul><li style=\\\"margin-left: 0cm;\\\"><span style=\\\"font-size: 11.0pt;\\\">Being a external search engine, it can be a bit slower (in the millisecond range). However, this is not completely true because the Coveo Platform is designed to process very complex query logic very fast. Indeed, other solution like Lucene sees the time needed for a query going up rapidly as the query is getting more and more complex.</span></li></ul>\\n\\u00a0<br><span style=\\\"font-size: 11.0pt;\\\">In addition, if you are using the Coveo Cloud Platform, the infrastructure powering your search experience is managed for you, thus eliminating the added complexity of managing dedicated Coveo machines. </span><br>\\u00a0\"], \"sfcreateddate\": [1511968968], \"kav_owner.coveo_record_size\": [2], \"kav_coveo_effective_modstamp\": [1517485622], \"kav_summary__html_stripped\": [\"\"], \"kav_dc_article_type\": [\"How To/Question\"], \"kav_dc_product\": [\"Sitecore\"], \"ka_coveo_record_size\": [2], \"kav_dc_expanded_article_type\": [\"All;All|How To/Question\"], \"kav_datacategoryselections.coveo_record_size\": [\"2;2\"], \"concepts\": [\"Cloud Platform ; Communication for User Adoption\"], \"source\": [\"Salesforce Public Items\"], \"kav_owner.attribute.url\": [\"/services/data/v34.0/sobjects/User/00532000005Jm2DAAS\"], \"parents\": [\"<?xml version=\\\"1.0\\\" encoding=\\\"utf-16\\\"?><parents><parent name=\\\"Organization\\\" uri=\\\"https://na61.salesforce.com/home/home.jsp\\\" /><parent name=\\\"Best_Practice__ka\\\" uri=\\\"http://www.salesforce.com/org:organization/articletype:Best_Practice\\\" /><parent name=\\\"Best Practices - Communication for User Adoption\\\" uri=\\\"https://na61.salesforce.com/kA032000000PNPq\\\" /></parents>\"], \"sfisvisibleinprm\": [true], \"kav_title\": [\"Best Practices - Communication for User Adoption\"], \"detectedtitle\": [\"Cloud Platform;Cloud Services;Coveo Enterprise Search;Salesforce;Sitecore\"], \"kav_isvisibleincsp\": [true], \"hashtmlversion\": [true], \"kav_versionnumber\": [2], \"sfcreatedbyname\": [\"Lipika Brahma\"], \"objecttypelabel\": [\"Best Practice\"], \"kav_articlenumber\": [\"000001906\"], \"sfdetailsc\": [\"With the launch of any new system or tool comes the challenge of change management and it is not very different when you launch your first Coveo experience, be it an intelligent workspace, intelligent self-service, intelligent site search or intelligent customer support. User adoption is a very important yet sometimes neglected aspect of any new product or process launch. We want our end-users to start using the new tool or system but often forget that adopting anything new takes effort and wouldn&#39;t we all just keep doing what we&#39;re already comfortable with rather than change ? We should always try to answer a very basic question for users, what&#39;s in it for them?<br><br>Here we discuss a few tried and tested methods around communication that will make the Coveo launch a successful one for all stakeholders. Most concepts here are inspired from the <a href=\\\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Practices_Guide_v6\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">KCS (Knowledge Centered Services) Practices Guide</a> and the <a href=\\\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Adoption_Guide\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">KCS Adoption Guide</a> that talk extensively around adoption for KCS but the same scenarios and challenges apply here as well. \\u00a0 \\u00a0\\n<h3><b>The Circle of User Feedback\\u00a0</b></h3>\\nUser feedback isn&#39;t just important after you&#39;ve gone live, it is important to capture feedback at every stage of your project. Why? Here&#39;s why.\\n\\n<ol><li><b>Feedback collected before project launch</b> provides important input for the first and a very important stage of your project - Requirements gathering. It makes sense to capture current challenges to build a user-centric product. Some examples of questions to ask could be. What are your current challenges with finding the right information ? To which the answers could vary from information being outdated to not having access to the right systems, not knowing where to find what. Building a system for the users that solves their current challenges will ensure better adoption and will instill a sense of trust in them to provide further feedback.</li><li><b>Feedback collected mid-project / Phased rollout</b>: Now that you are building a user centric product, it is important to do a test run of what you have built before making it available to all users. Not to be dramatic but wouldn&#39;t you want to do a test run before you roll out something to your entire organization. This doesn&#39;t\\u00a0just mean user acceptance testing, it is aimed at collecting feedback and taking concrete steps to resolve them. Users involved in the test run will be the pioneers and will be the first ones to spread the word.\\u00a0</li><li><b>Feedback after launch :\\u00a0</b>Feedback after launch is essential in fine tuning your search results to make sure users always see relevant result set for their queries. Minor UI improvements / changes can improve productivity by leaps and bounds. Coveo analytics provides a rich set of data points for you to analyze user behavior but direct user feedback helps you close that loop.\\u00a0</li></ol>\\n\\n<h3><b>Leave nothing to be guessed\\u00a0</b></h3>\\nGetting your users ready for the change is the key to early adoption hence constant communication throughout the project lifecycle is important.Some key messages to relay\\u00a0\\n\\n<ol><li>What are the challenges that the new search will eradicate?\\u00a0</li><li>Why did your company invest in Coveo ? It is important to clearly outline the advantages in terms of the existing problems it will solve, will it make them more productive ?\\u00a0</li><li>Where can they find it ?\\u00a0</li><li>What systems or applications are being indexed ?\\u00a0</li><li>Does it replace any current systems ?\\u00a0</li><li>Is there a process change ?\\u00a0</li><li>What do they do if they don&#39;t find what they&#39;re looking for ? - Providing a point of feedback makes sure you capture those essentials comments (good or bad) to improve the search experience.\\u00a0</li></ol>\\nLast but not the least create a buzz around the launch and don&#39;t forget to respond to all the feedback that you get, if you are not able to alter something make sure to set expectations.\\u00a0\"], \"originalhtmlcharset\": [1200], \"coveo_connector_hasbinarydata\": [false], \"kav_lastpublisheddate\": [1492111204], \"sfsystemmodstamp\": [1517485622], \"ka_attribute.type\": [\"Best_Practice__ka\"], \"sfdcproduct\": [\"Cloud Platform;Cloud Services;Coveo Enterprise Search;Salesforce;Sitecore\"], \"objecttypelabelplural\": [\"Best Practices\"], \"sftitle\": [\"Best Practices - Communication for User Adoption\"], \"kav_owner.id\": [\"00532000005Jm2DAAS\"], \"body\": [\"<html>   <body>     <div style=\\\"background-color: #fff;border: 2px solid #BBC5CC;border-radius: 4px;float: left;font-family: lato;margin-left: 15px;margin-right: 15px;margin-bottom: 4%;padding: 10px;width: 60%;\\\">       <div style=\\\"font-size: 1.5em;font-weight: 600;Padding-top: 30px;border-bottom: 1px solid #BBC5CC;\\\">         <div style=\\\"border-left: 1px solid #BBC5CC;border-top: 1px solid #BBC5CC;color: #296896;padding: 10px;width: 15%;\\\">           Information         </div>       </div>       <br/>       <table>         <tr>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Article Number</td><td>000001906</td>         </tr>         <tr>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Published</td><td>1492111204</td>         </tr>         <tr>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Product</td><td>Cloud Platform;Cloud Services;Coveo Enterprise Search;Salesforce;Sitecore</td>         </tr>       </table>       <br/>       <div style=\\\"font-size: 1.5em;font-weight: 600;Padding-top: 30px;border-bottom: 1px solid #BBC5CC;\\\">         <div style=\\\"border-left: 1px solid #BBC5CC;border-top: 1px solid #BBC5CC;color: #296896;padding: 10px;width: 15%;\\\">           Details         </div>       </div>       <div style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;\\\">With the launch of any new system or tool comes the challenge of change management and it is not very different when you launch your first Coveo experience, be it an intelligent workspace, intelligent self-service, intelligent site search or intelligent customer support. User adoption is a very important yet sometimes neglected aspect of any new product or process launch. We want our end-users to start using the new tool or system but often forget that adopting anything new takes effort and wouldn&#39;t we all just keep doing what we&#39;re already comfortable with rather than change ? We should always try to answer a very basic question for users, what&#39;s in it for them?<br><br>Here we discuss a few tried and tested methods around communication that will make the Coveo launch a successful one for all stakeholders. Most concepts here are inspired from the <a href=\\\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Practices_Guide_v6\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">KCS (Knowledge Centered Services) Practices Guide</a> and the <a href=\\\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Adoption_Guide\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">KCS Adoption Guide</a> that talk extensively around adoption for KCS but the same scenarios and challenges apply here as well. \\u00a0 \\u00a0\\n<h3><b>The Circle of User Feedback\\u00a0</b></h3>\\nUser feedback isn&#39;t just important after you&#39;ve gone live, it is important to capture feedback at every stage of your project. Why? Here&#39;s why.\\n\\n<ol><li><b>Feedback collected before project launch</b> provides important input for the first and a very important stage of your project - Requirements gathering. It makes sense to capture current challenges to build a user-centric product. Some examples of questions to ask could be. What are your current challenges with finding the right information ? To which the answers could vary from information being outdated to not having access to the right systems, not knowing where to find what. Building a system for the users that solves their current challenges will ensure better adoption and will instill a sense of trust in them to provide further feedback.</li><li><b>Feedback collected mid-project / Phased rollout</b>: Now that you are building a user centric product, it is important to do a test run of what you have built before making it available to all users. Not to be dramatic but wouldn&#39;t you want to do a test run before you roll out something to your entire organization. This doesn&#39;t\\u00a0just mean user acceptance testing, it is aimed at collecting feedback and taking concrete steps to resolve them. Users involved in the test run will be the pioneers and will be the first ones to spread the word.\\u00a0</li><li><b>Feedback after launch :\\u00a0</b>Feedback after launch is essential in fine tuning your search results to make sure users always see relevant result set for their queries. Minor UI improvements / changes can improve productivity by leaps and bounds. Coveo analytics provides a rich set of data points for you to analyze user behavior but direct user feedback helps you close that loop.\\u00a0</li></ol>\\n\\n<h3><b>Leave nothing to be guessed\\u00a0</b></h3>\\nGetting your users ready for the change is the key to early adoption hence constant communication throughout the project lifecycle is important.Some key messages to relay\\u00a0\\n\\n<ol><li>What are the challenges that the new search will eradicate?\\u00a0</li><li>Why did your company invest in Coveo ? It is important to clearly outline the advantages in terms of the existing problems it will solve, will it make them more productive ?\\u00a0</li><li>Where can they find it ?\\u00a0</li><li>What systems or applications are being indexed ?\\u00a0</li><li>Does it replace any current systems ?\\u00a0</li><li>Is there a process change ?\\u00a0</li><li>What do they do if they don&#39;t find what they&#39;re looking for ? - Providing a point of feedback makes sure you capture those essentials comments (good or bad) to improve the search experience.\\u00a0</li></ol>\\nLast but not the least create a buzz around the launch and don&#39;t forget to respond to all the feedback that you get, if you are not able to alter something make sure to set expectations.\\u00a0</div>     </div>   </body> </html>\"], \"sfisvisibleinapp\": [true], \"ka_attribute.url\": [\"/services/data/v34.0/sobjects/Best_Practice__ka/kA032000000PNPqCAO\"], \"sfdcarticletype\": [\"How To/Question\"], \"sfislatestversion\": [true], \"kav_details__c__html_stripped\": [\"With the launch of any new system or tool comes the challenge of change management and it is not very different when you launch your first Coveo experience, be it an intelligent workspace, intelligent self-service, intelligent site search or intelligent customer support. User adoption is a very important yet sometimes neglected aspect of any new product or process launch. We want our end-users to start using the new tool or system but often forget that adopting anything new takes effort and wouldn't we all just keep doing what we're already comfortable with rather than change ? We should always try to answer a very basic question for users, what's in it for them? \\n \\n Here we discuss a few tried and tested methods around communication that will make the Coveo launch a successful one for all stakeholders. Most concepts here are inspired from the  KCS (Knowledge Centered Services) Practices Guide  and the  KCS Adoption Guide  that talk extensively around adoption for KCS but the same scenarios and challenges apply here as well. \\u00a0 \\u00a0\\n The Circle of User Feedback\\u00a0 \\nUser feedback isn't just important after you've gone live, it is important to capture feedback at every stage of your project. Why? Here's why.\\n\\n Feedback collected before project launch  provides important input for the first and a very important stage of your project - Requirements gathering. It makes sense to capture current challenges to build a user-centric product. Some examples of questions to ask could be. What are your current challenges with finding the right information ? To which the answers could vary from information being outdated to not having access to the right systems, not knowing where to find what. Building a system for the users that solves their current challenges will ensure better adoption and will instill a sense of trust in them to provide further feedback. Feedback collected mid-project / Phased rollout : Now that you are building a user centric product, it is important to do a test run of what you have built before making it available to all users. Not to be dramatic but wouldn't you want to do a test run before you roll out something to your entire organization. This doesn't\\u00a0just mean user acceptance testing, it is aimed at collecting feedback and taking concrete steps to resolve them. Users involved in the test run will be the pioneers and will be the first ones to spread the word.\\u00a0 Feedback after launch :\\u00a0 Feedback after launch is essential in fine tuning your search results to make sure users always see relevant result set for their queries. Minor UI improvements / changes can improve productivity by leaps and bounds. Coveo analytics provides a rich set of data points for you to analyze user behavior but direct user feedback helps you close that loop.\\u00a0 \\n\\n Leave nothing to be guessed\\u00a0 \\nGetting your users ready for the change is the key to early adoption hence constant communication throughout the project lifecycle is important.Some key messages to relay\\u00a0\\n\\n What are the challenges that the new search will eradicate?\\u00a0 Why did your company invest in Coveo ? It is important to clearly outline the advantages in terms of the existing problems it will solve, will it make them more productive ?\\u00a0 Where can they find it ?\\u00a0 What systems or applications are being indexed ?\\u00a0 Does it replace any current systems ?\\u00a0 Is there a process change ?\\u00a0 What do they do if they don't find what they're looking for ? - Providing a point of feedback makes sure you capture those essentials comments (good or bad) to improve the search experience.\\u00a0 \\nLast but not the least create a buzz around the launch and don't forget to respond to all the feedback that you get, if you are not able to alter something make sure to set expectations.\\u00a0\"], \"sfarticlenumber\": [\"000001906\"], \"contenttype\": [\"binarydata\"], \"sfurlname\": [\"000001906\"], \"ka_id\": [\"kA032000000PNPqCAO\"], \"kav_datacategoryselections.datacategoryname\": [\"Coveo_Enterprise_Search;Cloud_Platform;Cloud_Services;Salesforce;Sitecore;How_To\"], \"coveo_url\": [\"https://na61.salesforce.com/kA032000000PNPq\"], \"kav_urlname\": [\"000001906\"], \"kav_dc_expanded_product\": [\"All;All|Cloud Platform;All|Cloud Services;All|Coveo Enterprise Search;All|Salesforce;All|Sitecore\"], \"foldingcollection\": [\"1fe7fdf88f7677dfa6e520d6e1bd957c1bbe19d123ede333241f04f0176c\"], \"kav_details__c\": [\"With the launch of any new system or tool comes the challenge of change management and it is not very different when you launch your first Coveo experience, be it an intelligent workspace, intelligent self-service, intelligent site search or intelligent customer support. User adoption is a very important yet sometimes neglected aspect of any new product or process launch. We want our end-users to start using the new tool or system but often forget that adopting anything new takes effort and wouldn&#39;t we all just keep doing what we&#39;re already comfortable with rather than change ? We should always try to answer a very basic question for users, what&#39;s in it for them?<br><br>Here we discuss a few tried and tested methods around communication that will make the Coveo launch a successful one for all stakeholders. Why? Here&#39;s why.\\n\\n<ol><li><b>Feedback collected before project launch</b> provides important input for the first and a very important stage of your project - Requirements gathering. It makes sense to capture current challenges to build a user-centric product. Some examples of questions to ask could be. What are your current challenges with finding the right information ? To which the answers could vary from information being outdated to not having access to the right systems, not knowing where to find what. Building a system for the users that solves their current challenges will ensure better adoption and will instill a sense of trust in them to provide further feedback.</li><li><b>Feedback collected mid-project / Phased rollout</b>: Now that you are building a user centric product, it is important to do a test run of what you have built before making it available to all users. This doesn&#39;t\\u00a0just mean user acceptance testing, it is aimed at collecting feedback and taking concrete steps to resolve them. Users involved in the test run will be the pioneers and will be the first ones to spread the word.\\u00a0</li><li><b>Feedback after launch :\\u00a0</b>Feedback after launch is essential in fine tuning your search results to make sure users always see relevant result set for their queries. Minor UI improvements / changes can improve productivity by leaps and bounds. Coveo analytics provides a rich set of data points for you to analyze user behavior but direct user feedback helps you close that loop.\\u00a0</li></ol>\\n\\n<h3><b>Leave nothing to be guessed\\u00a0</b></h3>\\nGetting your users ready for the change is the key to early adoption hence constant communication throughout the project lifecycle is important.Some key messages to relay\\u00a0\\n\\n<ol><li>What are the challenges that the new search will eradicate?\\u00a0</li><li>Why did your company invest in Coveo ? User adoption is a very important yet sometimes neglected aspect of any new product or process launch. We want our end-users to start using the new tool or system but often forget that adopting anything new takes effort and wouldn&#39;t we all just keep doing what we&#39;re already comfortable with rather than change ? We should always try to answer a very basic question for users, what&#39;s in it for them?<br><br>Here we discuss a few tried and tested methods around communication that will make the Coveo launch a successful one for all stakeholders. Most concepts here are inspired from the <a href=\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Practices_Guide_v6\" target=\"_blank\">KCS (Knowledge Centered Services) Practices Guide</a> and the <a href=\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Adoption_Guide\" target=\"_blank\">KCS Adoption Guide</a> that talk extensively around adoption for KCS but the same scenarios and challenges apply here as well.    \n<h3><b>The Circle of User Feedback </b></h3>\nUser feedback isn&#39;t just important after you&#39;ve gone live, it is important to capture feedback at every stage of your project. Why? Here&#39;s why.\n\n<ol><li><b>Feedback collected before project launch</b> provides important input for the first and a very important stage of your project - Requirements gathering. It makes sense to capture current challenges to build a user-centric product. Some examples of questions to ask could be. What are your current challenges with finding the right information ? To which the answers could vary from information being outdated to not having access to the right systems, not knowing where to find what. Building a system for the users that solves their current challenges will ensure better adoption and will instill a sense of trust in them to provide further feedback.</li><li><b>Feedback collected mid-project / Phased rollout</b>: Now that you are building a user centric product, it is important to do a test run of what you have built before making it available to all users. Not to be dramatic but wouldn&#39;t you want to do a test run before you roll out something to your entire organization. This doesn&#39;t just mean user acceptance testing, it is aimed at collecting feedback and taking concrete steps to resolve them. Users involved in the test run will be the pioneers and will be the first ones to spread the word. </li><li><b>Feedback after launch : </b>Feedback after launch is essential in fine tuning your search results to make sure users always see relevant result set for their queries. This is not a good search result. This idea is to request that the search logic be changed to be more intuitive in this scenario. Creating new users takes a unusual amount of time in the Sitecore\\u00a0<br>\\u00a0</div>       <div style=\\\"font-size: 1.5em;font-weight: 600;Padding-top: 30px;border-bottom: 1px solid #BBC5CC;\\\">         <div style=\\\"border-left: 1px solid #BBC5CC;border-top: 1px solid #BBC5CC;color: #296896;padding: 10px;width: 15%;\\\">           Environment         </div>       </div>       <br/>       <table>         <tr>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Product</td>           <td>Sitecore</td>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Sitecore Version</td>           <td>8.0;N/A</td>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Connector</td>           <td>N/A</td>         </tr>         <tr>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Published</td>           <td>1464641699</td>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Version</td>           <td>3.0</td>           <td style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;font-weight: 600;\\\">Build</td>           <td>1226 to 1266</td>         </tr>       </table>       <br/>       <div style=\\\"font-size: 1.5em;font-weight: 600;Padding-top: 30px;border-bottom: 1px solid #BBC5CC;\\\">         <div style=\\\"border-left: 1px solid #BBC5CC;border-top: 1px solid #BBC5CC;color: #296896;padding: 10px;width: 15%;\\\">           Cause         </div>       </div>       <div style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;\\\"> This behavior is linked to 4 new events that were added in the Coveo for Sitecore Coveo.SearchProvider.config configuration file in release of January 2016 (1226).<br>\\u00a0\\n<pre class=\\\"ckeditor_codeblock\\\">\\n&lt;event name=&quot;user:created&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUserCreated&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;\\n      &lt;event name=&quot;user:updated&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUserUpdated&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;\\n      &lt;event name=&quot;user:deleted&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUserDeleted&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;\\n      &lt;event name=&quot;roles:usersAdded&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUsersAddedToRole&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;\\n      &lt;event name=&quot;roles:usersRemoved&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUsersRemovedFromRole&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;</pre>\\n<br>These events were added to allow better synchronization of the users permissions on items. However, it also introduced a conflict with some Sitecore processes, which in turns leads to delays in the publishing and user creation processes.</div>       <div style=\\\"font-size: 1.5em;font-weight: 600;Padding-top: 30px;border-bottom: 1px solid #BBC5CC;\\\">         <div style=\\\"border-left: 1px solid #BBC5CC;border-top: 1px solid #BBC5CC;color: #296896;padding: 10px;width: 15%;\\\">           Resolution         </div>       </div>       <div style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;\\\"> This product issue is fixed in the June 2016 release.<br><br>The workaround is to remove these event from the Coveo.SearhProvider.config<br>\\u00a0\\n<pre class=\\\"ckeditor_codeblock\\\">\\n&lt;event name=&quot;user:created&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUserCreated&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;\\n      &lt;event name=&quot;user:updated&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUserUpdated&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;\\n      &lt;event name=&quot;user:deleted&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUserDeleted&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;\\n      &lt;event name=&quot;roles:usersAdded&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUsersAddedToRole&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;\\n      &lt;event name=&quot;roles:usersRemoved&quot;&gt;\\n        &lt;handler type=&quot;Coveo.SearchProvider.Events.EntityEventHandler, Coveo.SearchProviderBase&quot; method=&quot;OnUsersRemovedFromRole&quot; /&gt;\\n      &lt;/event&gt;</pre>\\n<br>\\u00a0</div>     </div> Best practice is to boost articles that were answered and had the most positive activity.<br><br><u><b>Forum Fields Example:</b></u><br>Those are some of the fields you could index if they exist in your forum site so you can use them in your pipeline rule to highlight the most relevant and helpful forum.\\u200b\\n<ul><li>Pageview</li><li>Kudos</li><li>Answered</li><li>Best Expression</u></b><br>Once you have identified those fields, you can use a ranking expression with a small boost so if there are several articles with the\\u00a0same topic, the one with more kudos or page view or likes would show first instead of a forum without a reply.<br><br>Here some examples of forum boost<br><br>boost `@forumanswer==True` by 25<br>boost `@forumanswer==False` by -500 \\u00a0(you can demote forum articles with no answer)<br><br>You can set a boost for specific range<br>boost `@pageview&gt;=1 AND @aempageview&lt;=100` by 10<br>boost `@pageview&gt;100 AND @aempageview&lt;=1000` by 20<br>boost `@pageview&gt;1000 AND @aempageview&lt;=10000` by 30<br><br>boost `@followercount&lt;&gt;0` by 25<br>boost `@likecount&lt;&gt;0` by 25<br><br>If you have multiple rules that fit one article, the boost will add up.<br>@forumanswer == True boost 25<br>@likecount &lt;&gt; 0\\u00a0boost 25<br>If Forum article meet both rules, the weight will be 50 for this article<br><br><u><b>Important Note:</b></u><br>You may need to balance your other content so you do not have just forum showing at the top of your results.<br>If total of your forum articles boost can meet 50, you should boost your other content with similar weight or even higher if you want to show more of your KB content first<br>Example:<br>boost `@syssource==&quot;KB External&quot;`, `@syssource==&quot;Salesforce&quot;` by 100<br><br><u><b>Test:</b></u><br>Always test your rules in a temporary pipeline before enabling the rules in production<br>\\u00a0\"], \"originalhtmlcharset\": Best practice is to boost articles that were answered and had the most positive activity.<br><br><u><b>Forum Fields Example:</b></u><br>Those are some of the fields you could index if they exist in your forum site so you can use them in your pipeline rule to highlight the most relevant and helpful forum.\\u200b\\n<ul><li>Pageview</li><li>Kudos</li><li>Answered</li><li>Best Answer</li><li>Thumbs-up</li><li>Likes</li><li>Follower</li></ul>\\n<br>You can see the index field name in the content browser of your forum source.<br><br><img alt=\\\"User-added image\\\" height=\\\"285\\\" src=\\\"https://c.na61.content.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka032000000HACi&amp;feoid=00N32000002jMQL&amp;refid=0EM32000000VNpG\\\" width=\\\"500\\\"></img><br><br><b><u>Ranking Expression</u></b><br>Once you have identified those fields, you can use a ranking expression with a small boost so if there are several articles with the\\u00a0same topic, the one with more kudos or page view or likes would show first instead of a forum without a reply.<br><br>Here some examples of forum boost<br><br>boost `@forumanswer==True` by 25<br>boost `@forumanswer==False` by -500 \\u00a0(you can demote forum articles with no answer)<br><br>You can set a boost for specific range<br>boost `@pageview&gt;=1 AND @aempageview&lt;=100` by 10<br>boost `@pageview&gt;100 AND @aempageview&lt;=1000` by 20<br>boost `@pageview&gt;1000 AND @aempageview&lt;=10000` by 30<br><br>boost `@followercount&lt;&gt;0` by 25<br>boost `@likecount&lt;&gt;0` by 25<br><br>If you have multiple rules that fit one article, the boost will add up.<br>@forumanswer == True boost 25<br>@likecount &lt;&gt; 0\\u00a0boost 25<br>If Forum article meet both rules, the weight will be 50 for this article<br><br><u><b>Important Note:</b></u><br>You may need to balance your other content so you do not have just forum showing at the top of your results.<br>If total of your forum articles boost can meet 50, you should boost your other content with similar weight or even higher if you want to show more of your KB content first<br>Example:<br>boost `@syssource==&quot;KB External&quot;`, `@syssource==&quot;Salesforce&quot;` by 100<br><br><u><b>Test:</b></u><br>Always test your rules in a temporary pipeline before enabling the rules in production<br>\\u00a0</div>     </div>   </body> </html>\"], \"sfisvisibleinapp\": [true], \"ka_attribute.url\": [\"/services/data/v34.0/sobjects/Best_Practice__ka/kA032000000PO7OCAW\"], \"sfdcarticletype\": [\"How To/Question\"], \"sfislatestversion\": [true], \"kav_details__c__html_stripped\": [\"In the context of search, you want to show the forum articles that will help your end users find an answer. Best practice is to boost articles that were answered and had the most positive activity. \\n \\n Forum Fields Example: \\n Those are some of the fields you could index if they exist in your forum site so you can use them in your pipeline rule to highlight the most relevant and helpful forum.\\u200b\\n Pageview Kudos Answered Best Answer Thumbs-up Likes Follower \\n \\n You can see the index field name in the content browser of your forum source. \\n \\n  \\n \\n Ranking Expression \\n Once you have identified those fields, you can use a ranking expression with a small boost so if there are several articles with the\\u00a0same topic, the one with more kudos or page view or likes would show first instead of a forum without a reply. \\n \\n Here some examples of forum boost \\n \\n boost `@forumanswer==True` by 25 \\n boost `@forumanswer==False` by -500 \\u00a0(you can demote forum articles with no answer) \\n \\n You can set a boost for specific range \\n boost `@pageview>=1 AND @aempageview<=100` by 10 \\n boost `@pageview>100 AND @aempageview<=1000` by 20 \\n boost `@pageview>1000 AND @aempageview<=10000` by 30 \\n \\n boost `@followercount<>0` by 25 \\n boost `@likecount<>0` by 25 \\n \\n If you have multiple rules that fit one article, the boost will add up. \\n @forumanswer == True boost 25 \\n @likecount <> 0\\u00a0boost 25 \\n If Forum article meet both rules, the weight will be 50 for this article \\n \\n Important Note: \\n You may need to balance your other content so you do not have just forum showing at the top of your results. \\n If total of your forum articles boost can meet 50, you should boost your other content with similar weight or even higher if you want to show more of your KB content first \\n Example: \\n boost `@syssource==\\\"KB External\\\"`, `@syssource==\\\"Salesforce\\\"` by 100 \\n \\n Test: \\n Always test your rules in a temporary pipeline before enabling the rules in production \\n \\u00a0\"], \"foldingcollection\": [\"6b2546575037a0084c135d7417d3e23f2b1e1127c0537a2de67b13e5c985\"], \"kav_details__c\": [\"In the context of search, you want to show the forum articles that will help your end users find an answer. Best practice is to boost articles that were answered and had the most positive activity.<br><br><u><b>Forum Fields Example:</b></u><br>Those are some of the fields you could index if they exist in your forum site so you can use them in your pipeline rule to highlight the most relevant and helpful forum.\\u200b\\n<ul><li>Pageview</li><li>Kudos</li><li>Answered</li><li>Best Answer</li><li>Thumbs-up</li><li>Likes</li><li>Follower</li></ul>\\n<br>You can see the index field name in the content browser of your forum source.<br><br><img alt=\\\"User-added image\\\" height=\\\"285\\\" src=\\\"https://c.na61.content.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka032000000HACi&amp;feoid=00N32000002jMQL&amp;refid=0EM32000000VNpG\\\" width=\\\"500\\\"></img><br><br><b><u>Ranking Expression</u></b><br>Once you have identified those fields, you can use a ranking expression with a small boost so if there are several articles with the\\u00a0same topic, the one with more kudos or page view or likes would show first instead of a forum without a reply.<br><br>Here some examples of forum boost<br><br>boost `@forumanswer==True` by 25<br>boost `@forumanswer==False` by -500 \\u00a0(you can demote forum articles with no answer)<br><br>You can set a boost for specific range<br>boost `@pageview&gt;=1 AND @aempageview&lt;=100` by 10<br>boost `@pageview&gt;100 AND @aempageview&lt;=1000` by 20<br>boost `@pageview&gt;1000 AND @aempageview&lt;=10000` by 30<br><br>boost `@followercount&lt;&gt;0` by 25<br>boost `@likecount&lt;&gt;0` by 25<br><br>If you have multiple rules that fit one article, the boost will add up.<br>@forumanswer == True boost 25<br>@likecount &lt;&gt; 0\\u00a0boost 25<br>If Forum article meet both rules, the weight will be 50 for this article<br><br><u><b>Important Note:</b></u><br>You may need to balance your other content so you do not have just forum showing at the top of your results.<br>If total of your forum articles boost       "sfdetailsc" : "In the context of search, you want to show the forum articles that will help your end users find an answer. Best practice is to boost articles that were answered and had the most positive activity.<br><br><u><b>Forum Fields Example:</b></u><br>Those are some of the fields you could index if they exist in your forum site so you can use them in your pipeline rule to highlight the most relevant and helpful forum.\u200b\n<ul><li>Pageview</li><li>Kudos</li><li>Answered</li><li>Best Answer</li><li>Thumbs-up</li><li>Likes</li><li>Follower</li></ul>\n<br>You can see the index field name in the content browser of your forum source.<br><br><img alt=\"User-added image\" height=\"285\" src=\"https://c.na61.content.force.com/servlet/rtaImage?eid=ka032000000HACi&amp;feoid=00N32000002jMQL&amp;refid=0EM32000000VNpG\" width=\"500\"></img><br><br><b><u>Ranking Expression</u></b><br>Once you have identified those fields, you can use a ranking expression with a small boost so if there are several articles with the same topic, the one with more kudos or page view or likes would show first instead of a forum without a reply.<br><br>Here some examples of forum boost<br><br>boost `@forumanswer==True` by 25<br>boost `@forumanswer==False` by -500  (you can demote forum articles with no answer)<br><br>You can set a boost for specific range<br>boost `@pageview&gt;=1 AND @aempageview&lt;=100` by 10<br>boost `@pageview&gt;100 AND @aempageview&lt;=1000` by 20<br>boost `@pageview&gt;1000 AND @aempageview&lt;=10000` by 30<br><br>boost `@followercount&lt;&gt;0` by 25<br>boost `@likecount&lt;&gt;0` by 25<br><br>If you have multiple rules that fit one article, the boost will add up.<br>@forumanswer == True boost 25<br>@likecount &lt;&gt; 0 boost 25<br>If Forum article meet both rules, the weight will be 50 for this article<br><br><u><b>Important Note:</b></u><br>You may need to balance your other content so you do not have just forum showing at the top of your results.<br>If total of your forum articles boost can meet 50, you should boost your other content with similar weight or even higher if you want to show more of your KB content first<br>Example:<br>boost `@syssource==&quot;KB External&quot;`, `@syssource==&quot;Salesforce&quot;` by 100<br><br><u><b>Test:</b></u><br>Always test your rules in a temporary pipeline before enabling the rules in production<br> ",

Your agent could make a mistake and select the wrong origin<br><br>3) Time zone<br>Make sure both systems use the same time zone when comparing the results<br><br>4) Multiple submit actions<br>Some implementations does not grey out the submit button after submitting the case and customer can click multiple time the submit button<br><br>5) Two submits in the same visit<br>Unusual but it can happen where a customer enters 2 cases in one single visit. We use visit card to calculate case submit and this scenario, we would be short of 1 case.<br>We will soon add a reset visit after a customer submits a case to avoid that situation. As soon as a customer would submit his case and want to open the second case, they would be in two different visits.<br><br>6) Implementation issue\\u00a0<br>Select a day where you don&#39;t have too much case traffic.
