600;\\\">Product</td><td>Usage Analytics</td>         </tr>       </table>       <br/>       <div style=\\\"font-size: 1.5em;font-weight: 600;Padding-top: 30px;border-bottom: 1px solid #BBC5CC;\\\">         <div style=\\\"border-left: 1px solid #BBC5CC;border-top: 1px solid #BBC5CC;color: #296896;padding: 10px;width: 15%;\\\">           Details         </div>       </div>       <div style=\\\"margin-left: 35px;margin-top: 10px;font-size: 1em;\\\"><h2 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Summary</b></h2>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">One Dreamforce morning, a group of like-minded folks gathered to have breakfast and talk about the challenges they are facing this coming year as it relates to introducing change within their contact centers as well as managing agent performance. \\u00a0</b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">The lively morning discussions were held by 18 different Coveo Customer Success &amp; Support Leaders supported by an eager group of Coveo note takers.</b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">We hope all participants walked away with a renewed outlook on common agent proficiency challenges facing companies across industries, but more than understanding, we hope participants were also inspired with ideas regarding how to help your company solve these challenges.</b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">We use these informative conversations to continuously improve our products and services to better meet your needs. Below you will find a recap of the questions we asked, as well as the common themes that emerged from those conversations. </b></p>\\n\\n<h2 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">The questions that started the conversations</b></h2>\\n\\n<ol><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<h3 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">How are you measuring agent adoption / proficiency?</b></h3>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ul style=\\\"margin-left: 80px;\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Scattered information storing is a common challenge facing companies across the board. To combat this, implement a cohesive KCS workflow structure - One customer who recently launched a KCS pilot is already seeing positive impacts through measuring:</b></p>\\n\\n\\t<ul><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">AQI (Article Quality Index) which provides article confidence</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Attachment rates (% of cases attached/associated to a support case)</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">article reuse \\u00a0(how often is an article being reused to solve a customer problem)</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li></ul>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Operationally, businesses are measuring content relevancy by measuring:</b></p>\\n\\n\\t<ul><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Click-throughs and click ranks. \\u00a0</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Time spent on a page or article</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Engagement with site and content</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Number of users</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li></ul>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Measuring the impact agent performance has on business continues be a struggle for many. It\\u2019s recognized that we have to change and focus performance measurement on outcomes at the team level. However, change is hard. As an industry we\\u2019ve been focused on activity based measures for so long, that the shift continues to be a challenge for most.</b></p>\\n\\t</li></ul>\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"2\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<h3 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">How are you driving Adoption to increase agent time to proficiency?</b></h3>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ul style=\\\"margin-left: 80px;\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Working with agents all over of the world can make it a challenge to implement change and drive adoption of new technology, operational practices, and workflows for fear of missing objectives established by executives. (see point #1)</b></p>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Be careful about the incentives you do set: warns one customer who set out a 100% attachment rate of KB articles to cases. The result - agents wanting to meet their performance objectives (which are often tied to financial incentives), were not always attaching relevant content to their cases. \\u00a0This results in data integrity problems which defeats the whole purpose for linking cases &amp; articles.</b></p>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Best Practice shows us that a link/attachment rate of 65%-80% is the industry benchmark. \\u00a0This may fluctuate with product/service release cycles, as fewer knowledgebase articles are immediately available when a new product or service is released. </b></p>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Agents have much stronger adoption rates when they understand how their individual or team contribution is impacting the overall customer experience and organizational goals. Best Practice is to create cascading goals from the top down that enable the agent to see a direct correlation in their behaviour to meeting the corporate objectives. </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ul>\\n\\u00a0\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"3\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<h3 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">What metrics are you using to identify success signals and tell the story?</b></h3>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ul style=\\\"margin-left: 80px;\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Case Deflection, defined as the percentage of interactions that are taking place on a self-service community/portal that would have otherwise resulted in an assisted-service transaction in the contact center, \\u00a0is the most common theme for measuring business outcomes. Coveo products have the ability to accurately measure trends. This has significantly reduced effort for many who were previously calculating this manually in spreadsheets.</b></p>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Leaders also ask, \\u201cHow strong is my content?\\u201d, \\u201cWhat am I missing?\\u201d \\u00a0to track other signals. </b></p>\\n\\n\\t<ul><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Measurement Best Practices include metrics like:<br>\\t\\ta) Case Deflection &amp; Self Service Success - Understanding that both are important measures, but that there is a difference. \\u00a0Just because someone visits your portal, does not necessarily mean a case was deflected from an assisted service channel. \\u00a0</b><br>\\t\\t<b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">b) Content Gaps &amp; Top Content - This data helps facilitate the need for increased alignment and collaboration on content creation, and sharing. The data helps everyone understand the importance of a solid content management strategy.</b><br>\\t\\t<b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">c) Cases - New vs Known. \\u00a0Complete a study to analyze what percentage of the support cases coming into your assisted service channel get resolved with a known answer. \\u00a0This is what the industry refers to as \\u201cnew\\u201d vs \\u201cknown\\u201d. \\u00a0Understanding this will help you better identify how much \\u201cself-service\\u201d tools will be able to help.</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li></ul>\\n\\t</li></ul>\\n\\n<h2 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Themes</b></h2>\\n\\n<ol><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Relevant Content is critical. \\u00a0Leading enterprises are still struggling to empower agents with the right information because of inefficient knowledge sharing across devices and sources. By identifying content usage metrics that will point your organization toward the most relevant content, and creating agent performance metrics (linked to organizational performance) to increase those metrics, businesses will be able to guide content creation activities for the benefit of all. </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\u00a0\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"2\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Kernel\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">KCS v6 (Knowledge Centered Service)</a> is an industry recognized best practice methodology. KCS was well known and being practiced by some, but was also very new to others. Coveo has the most KCS v6 certified employees of any organization, including several KCS Academy certified trainers who offer training and knowledge management related services for those interested in <a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/services/knowledge-management\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">learning more.</a></b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"3\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Improving agent metrics can be a long journey. Tieing adoption goals to overall business goals will guide a business\\u2019s path to success. Agents can be resistant to change when they can\\u2019t see the larger picture. Weaving temporary incentives that promote a customer-centric approach into agent workflow processes will help guide your entire organization towards the same goals. </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"4\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">A Customer-Centric Experience is Holistic. </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\" style=\\\"margin-left: 40px;\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">For a company to experience positive change, incentives can be woven into the companies\\u2019s culture. The Agent experience is one facet of the a comprehensive customer experience strategy - it\\u2019s can\\u2019t be treated in isolation. The self-service experience and agent experience now go hand in hand to deliver an overall Customer Experience.</b></p>\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"5\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Evaluate Messaging Capabilities to meet Customer Demands in Real Time </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\" style=\\\"margin-left: 40px;\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">It\\u2019s crucial to consistently evaluate the new tools available to agents to ensure your meeting customer expectations while balancing current organizational goals. \\u00a0Many are turning to chat as a cheaper, and more customer satisfying assisted service channel of operation. \\u00a0However it important to recognize that even though agents love it, since it\\u2019s always on, there is a higher rate of agent burnout. \\u00a0It was felt that the best practice was to rotate agents into a \\u201cchat\\u201d team for a period of time and then leverage other channel experiences - phone &amp; email to provide a balance.</b></p>\\n\\u00a0\\n\\n<h2 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Additional Resources</b></h2>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Below are a few links to some additional readings and resources we thought you may also enjoy.</b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/coveo-relevance-maturity-model\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">From Relevance Laggard to Leader: Becoming More Relevant to Your Customers, Communities and Staff</a></b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/your-roadmap-to-intelligent-assisted-support\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Your Roadmap to Intelligent Assisted Support</a> </b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/the-state-of-knowledge-management-2014\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">TSIA Report: The Value of Unified Search in Customer Service</a></b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/the-five-essential-steps-to-plan-your-CX-transformation-the-strategy-report\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Forrester whitepaper: The Five Essential Steps To Plan Your CX Transformation </a></b></p>\\n\\n<h3 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/forrester-research-brief-cognitive-search-is-ready-to-rev-up-your-enterprise\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Forrester Research Brief: Cognitive Search Is Ready To Rev Up Your Enterprise&#39;s IQ</a></b></h3>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\u00a0</p>\\n\\u00a0\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\u00a0</p></div>     </div>   </body> </html>\"], \"sfisvisibleinapp\": [true], \"ka_attribute.url\": [\"/services/data/v34.0/sobjects/Best_Practice__ka/kA00d0000009ASqCAM\"], \"sfdcarticletype\": [\"How To/Question\"], \"sfislatestversion\": [true], \"kav_details__c__html_stripped\": [\"Summary \\n\\n One Dreamforce morning, a group of like-minded folks gathered to have breakfast and talk about the challenges they are facing this coming year as it relates to introducing change within their contact centers as well as managing agent performance. \\u00a0\\n \\n\\n The lively morning discussions were held by 18 different Coveo Customer Success & Support Leaders supported by an eager group of Coveo note takers.\\n \\n\\n We hope all participants walked away with a renewed outlook on common agent proficiency challenges facing companies across industries, but more than understanding, we hope participants were also inspired with ideas regarding how to help your company solve these challenges.\\n \\n\\n We use these informative conversations to continuously improve our products and services to better meet your needs. Below you will find a recap of the questions we asked, as well as the common themes that emerged from those conversations. \\n \\n\\n The questions that started the conversations \\n\\n \\n\\t How are you measuring agent adoption / proficiency? \\n\\t \\n\\n \\n\\t Scattered information storing is a common challenge facing companies across the board. To combat this, implement a cohesive KCS workflow structure - One customer who recently launched a KCS pilot is already seeing positive impacts through measuring:\\n \\n\\n\\t \\n\\t\\t AQI (Article Quality Index) which provides article confidence\\n \\n\\t\\t \\n\\t\\t Attachment rates (% of cases attached/associated to a support case)\\n \\n\\t\\t \\n\\t\\t article reuse \\u00a0(how often is an article being reused to solve a customer problem)\\n \\n\\t\\t \\n\\t \\n\\t Operationally, businesses are measuring content relevancy by measuring:\\n \\n\\n\\t \\n\\t\\t Click-throughs and click ranks. \\u00a0\\n \\n\\t\\t \\n\\t\\t Time spent on a page or article\\n \\n\\t\\t \\n\\t\\t Engagement with site and content\\n \\n\\t\\t \\n\\t\\t Number of users\\n \\n\\t\\t \\n\\t \\n\\t Measuring the impact agent performance has on business continues be a struggle for many. It\\u2019s recognized that we have to change and focus performance measurement on outcomes at the team level. However, change is hard. As an industry we\\u2019ve been focused on activity based measures for so long, that the shift continues to be a challenge for most.\\n \\n\\t \\n\\n \\n\\t How are you driving Adoption to increase agent time to proficiency? \\n\\t \\n\\n \\n\\t Working with agents all over of the world can make it a challenge to implement change and drive adoption of new technology, operational practices, and workflows for fear of missing objectives established by executives. (see point #1)\\n \\n\\t \\n\\t Be careful about the incentives you do set: warns one customer who set out a 100% attachment rate of KB articles to cases. The result - agents wanting to meet their performance objectives (which are often tied to financial incentives), were not always attaching relevant content to their cases. \\u00a0This results in data integrity problems which defeats the whole purpose for linking cases & articles.\\n \\n\\t \\n\\t Best Practice shows us that a link/attachment rate of 65%-80% is the industry benchmark. \\u00a0This may fluctuate with product/service release cycles, as fewer knowledgebase articles are immediately available when a new product or service is released. \\n \\n\\t \\n\\t Agents have much stronger adoption rates when they understand how their individual or team contribution is impacting the overall customer experience and organizational goals. Best Practice is to create cascading goals from the top down that enable the agent to see a direct correlation in their behaviour to meeting the corporate objectives. \\n \\n\\t \\n\\u00a0\\n\\n \\n\\t What metrics are you using to identify success signals and tell the story? \\n\\t \\n\\n \\n\\t Case Deflection, defined as the percentage of interactions that are taking place on a self-service community/portal that would have otherwise resulted in an assisted-service transaction in the contact center, \\u00a0is the most common theme for measuring business outcomes. Coveo products have the ability to accurately measure trends. This has significantly reduced effort for many who were previously calculating this manually in spreadsheets.\\n \\n\\t \\n\\t Leaders also ask, \\u201cHow strong is my content?\\u201d, \\u201cWhat am I missing?\\u201d \\u00a0to track other signals. \\n \\n\\n\\t \\n\\t\\t Measurement Best Practices include metrics like: \\n \\t\\ta) Case Deflection & Self Service Success - Understanding that both are important measures, but that there is a difference. \\u00a0Just because someone visits your portal, does not necessarily mean a case was deflected from an assisted service channel. \\u00a0 \\n \\t\\t b) Content Gaps & Top Content - This data helps facilitate the need for increased alignment and collaboration on content creation, and sharing. The data helps everyone understand the importance of a solid content management strategy. \\n \\t\\t c) Cases - New vs Known. \\u00a0Complete a study to analyze what percentage of the support cases coming into your assisted service channel get resolved with a known answer. \\u00a0This is what the industry refers to as \\u201cnew\\u201d vs \\u201cknown\\u201d. \\u00a0Understanding this will help you better identify how much \\u201cself-service\\u201d tools will be able to help.\\n \\n\\t\\t \\n\\t \\n\\n Themes \\n\\n \\n\\t Relevant Content is critical. \\u00a0Leading enterprises are still struggling to empower agents with the right information because of inefficient knowledge sharing across devices and sources. By identifying content usage metrics that will point your organization toward the most relevant content, and creating agent performance metrics (linked to organizational performance) to increase those metrics, businesses will be able to guide content creation activities for the benefit of all. \\n \\n\\t \\n\\u00a0\\n\\n \\n\\t KCS v6 (Knowledge Centered Service)  is an industry recognized best practice methodology. KCS was well known and being practiced by some, but was also very new to others. Coveo has the most KCS v6 certified employees of any organization, including several KCS Academy certified trainers who offer training and knowledge management related services for those interested in  learning more.\\n \\n\\t \\n\\n \\n\\t Improving agent metrics can be a long journey. Tieing adoption goals to overall business goals will guide a business\\u2019s path to success. Agents can be resistant to change when they can\\u2019t see the larger picture. Weaving temporary incentives that promote a customer-centric approach into agent workflow processes will help guide your entire organization towards the same goals. \\n \\n\\t \\n\\n \\n\\t A Customer-Centric Experience is Holistic. \\n \\n\\t \\n\\n For a company to experience positive change, incentives can be woven into the companies\\u2019s culture. The Agent experience is one facet of the a comprehensive customer experience strategy - it\\u2019s can\\u2019t be treated in isolation. The self-service experience and agent experience now go hand in hand to deliver an overall Customer Experience.\\n \\n\\n \\n\\t Evaluate Messaging Capabilities to meet Customer Demands in Real Time \\n \\n\\t \\n\\n It\\u2019s crucial to consistently evaluate the new tools available to agents to ensure your meeting customer expectations while balancing current organizational goals. \\u00a0Many are turning to chat as a cheaper, and more customer satisfying assisted service channel of operation. \\u00a0However it important to recognize that even though agents love it, since it\\u2019s always on, there is a higher rate of agent burnout. \\u00a0It was felt that the best practice was to rotate agents into a \\u201cchat\\u201d team for a period of time and then leverage other channel experiences - phone & email to provide a balance.\\n \\n\\u00a0\\n\\n Additional Resources \\n\\n Below are a few links to some additional readings and resources we thought you may also enjoy.\\n Unified Search in Customer Service\\n \\n\\n Forrester whitepaper: The Five Essential Steps To Plan Your CX Transformation \\n \\n\\n Forrester Research Brief: Cognitive Search Is Ready To Rev Up Your Enterprise's IQ \\n\\n \\u00a0\\n \\n\\u00a0\\n\\n \\u00a0\\n\"], \"sfarticlenumber\": [\"000002788\"], \"contenttype\": [\"binarydata\"], \"sfurlname\": [\"2788\"], \"ka_id\": \"kav_dc_expanded_product\": [\"All;All|Usage Analytics\"], \"foldingcollection\": [\"992e6b828260682cc371d27bc4d5d2a0cd7530ed91b5965a0d0d9d11d368\"], \"kav_details__c\": [\"<h2 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Summary</b></h2>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">One Dreamforce as managing agent performance. \\u00a0</b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">The lively morning discussions were held by 18 different with ideas regarding how to help your company solve these challenges.</b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">We use these informative conversations to continuously improve our products and services to better meet your needs. Below you will find a recap of the questions we asked, as well as the common themes that emerged from those conversations. </b></p>\\n\\n<h2 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">The questions that started the conversations</b></h2>\\n\\n<ol><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<h3 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">How are you measuring agent adoption / proficiency?</b></h3>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ul style=\\\"margin-left: 80px;\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Scattered information storing is a common challenge facing companies across the board. To combat this, implement a cohesive KCS workflow structure - One customer who recently launched a KCS pilot is already seeing positive impacts through measuring:</b></p>\\n\\n\\t<ul><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">AQI (Article Quality Index) which provides article confidence</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Attachment rates (% of cases attached/associated to a support case)</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">article reuse \\u00a0(how often is an article being reused to solve a customer problem)</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li></ul>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Operationally, businesses are measuring content relevancy by measuring:</b></p>\\n\\n\\t<ul><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Click-throughs and click ranks. \\u00a0</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Time spent on a page or article</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Engagement with site and content</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Number of users</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li></ul>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Measuring the impact agent performance has on business continues be a struggle for many. It\\u2019s recognized that we have to change and focus performance measurement on outcomes at the team level. However, change is hard. As an industry we\\u2019ve been focused on activity based measures for so long, that the shift continues to be a challenge for most.</b></p>\\n\\t</li></ul>\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"2\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<h3 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">How are you driving Adoption to increase agent time to proficiency?</b></h3>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ul style=\\\"margin-left: 80px;\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Working with agents all over of the world can make it a challenge to implement change and drive adoption of new technology, operational practices, and workflows for fear of missing objectives established by executives. (see point #1)</b></p>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Be careful about the incentives you do set: warns one customer who set out a 100% attachment rate of KB articles to cases. The result - agents wanting to meet their performance objectives (which are often tied to financial incentives), were not always attaching relevant content to their cases. \\u00a0This results in data integrity problems which defeats the whole purpose for linking cases &amp; articles.</b></p>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Best Practice shows us that a link/attachment rate of 65%-80% is the industry benchmark. \\u00a0This may fluctuate with product/service release cycles, as fewer knowledgebase articles are immediately available when a new product or service is released. </b></p>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Agents have much stronger adoption rates when they understand how their individual or team contribution is impacting the overall customer experience and organizational goals. Best Practice is to create cascading goals from the top down that enable the agent to see a direct correlation in their behaviour to meeting the corporate objectives. </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ul>\\n\\u00a0\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"3\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<h3 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">What metrics are you using to identify success signals and tell the story?</b></h3>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ul style=\\\"margin-left: 80px;\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Case Deflection, defined as the percentage of interactions that are taking place on a self-service community/portal that would have otherwise resulted in an assisted-service transaction in the contact center, \\u00a0is the most common theme for measuring business outcomes. Coveo products have the ability to accurately measure trends. This has significantly reduced effort for many who were previously calculating this manually in spreadsheets.</b></p>\\n\\t</li><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Leaders also ask, \\u201cHow strong is my content?\\u201d, \\u201cWhat am I missing?\\u201d \\u00a0to track other signals. </b></p>\\n\\n\\t<ul><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Measurement Best Practices include metrics like:<br>\\t\\ta) Case Deflection &amp; Self Service Success - Understanding that both are important measures, but that there is a difference. \\u00a0Just because someone visits your portal, does not necessarily mean a case was deflected from an assisted service channel. \\u00a0</b><br>\\t\\t<b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">b) Content Gaps &amp; Top Content - This data helps facilitate the need for increased alignment and collaboration on content creation, and sharing. The data helps everyone understand the importance of a solid content management strategy.</b><br>\\t\\t<b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">c) Cases - New vs Known. \\u00a0Complete a study to analyze what percentage of the support cases coming into your assisted service channel get resolved with a known answer. \\u00a0This is what the industry refers to as \\u201cnew\\u201d vs \\u201cknown\\u201d. \\u00a0Understanding this will help you better identify how much \\u201cself-service\\u201d tools will be able to help.</b></p>\\n\\t\\t</li></ul>\\n\\t</li></ul>\\n\\n<h2 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Themes</b></h2>\\n\\n<ol><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Relevant Content is critical. \\u00a0Leading enterprises are still struggling to empower agents with the right information because of inefficient knowledge sharing across devices and sources. By identifying content usage metrics that will point your organization toward the most relevant content, and creating agent performance metrics (linked to organizational performance) to increase those metrics, businesses will be able to guide content creation activities for the benefit of all. </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\u00a0\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"2\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Kernel\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">KCS v6 (Knowledge Centered Service)</a> is an industry recognized best practice methodology. KCS was well known and being practiced by some, but was also very new to others. Coveo has the most KCS v6 certified employees of any organization, including several KCS Academy certified trainers who offer training and knowledge management related services for those interested in <a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/services/knowledge-management\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">learning more.</a></b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"3\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Improving agent metrics can be a long journey. Tieing adoption goals to overall business goals will guide a business\\u2019s path to success. Agents can be resistant to change when they can\\u2019t see the larger picture. Weaving temporary incentives that promote a customer-centric approach into agent workflow processes will help guide your entire organization towards the same goals. </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"4\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">A Customer-Centric Experience is Holistic. </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\" style=\\\"margin-left: 40px;\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">For a company to experience positive change, incentives can be woven into the companies\\u2019s culture. The Agent experience is one facet of the a comprehensive customer experience strategy - it\\u2019s can\\u2019t be treated in isolation. The self-service experience and agent experience now go hand in hand to deliver an overall Customer Experience.</b></p>\\n\\n<ol start=\\\"5\\\"><li dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\n\\t<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Evaluate Messaging Capabilities to meet Customer Demands in Real Time </b></p>\\n\\t</li></ol>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\" style=\\\"margin-left: 40px;\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">It\\u2019s crucial to consistently evaluate the new tools available to agents to ensure your meeting customer expectations while balancing current organizational goals. \\u00a0Many are turning to chat as a cheaper, and more customer satisfying assisted service channel of operation. \\u00a0However it important to recognize that even though agents love it, since it\\u2019s always on, there is a higher rate of agent burnout. \\u00a0It was felt that the best practice was to rotate agents into a \\u201cchat\\u201d team for a period of time and then leverage other channel experiences - phone &amp; email to provide a balance.</b></p>\\n\\u00a0\\n\\n<h2 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Additional Resources</b></h2>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\">Below are a few links to some additional readings and resources we thought you may also enjoy.</b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/coveo-relevance-maturity-model\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">From Relevance Laggard to Leader: Becoming More Relevant to Your Customers, Communities and Staff</a></b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/your-roadmap-to-intelligent-assisted-support\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Your Roadmap to Intelligent Assisted Support</a> </b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/the-state-of-knowledge-management-2014\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">TSIA Report: The Value of Unified Search in Customer Service</a></b></p>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/the-five-essential-steps-to-plan-your-CX-transformation-the-strategy-report\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Forrester whitepaper: The Five Essential Steps To Plan Your CX Transformation </a></b></p>\\n\\n<h3 dir=\\\"ltr\\\"><b id=\\\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\\\"><a href=\\\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/forrester-research-brief-cognitive-search-is-ready-to-rev-up-your-enterprise\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\">Forrester Research Brief: Cognitive Search Is Ready To Rev Up Your Enterprise&#39;s IQ</a></b></h3>\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\u00a0</p>\\n\\u00a0\\n\\n<p dir=\\\"ltr\\\">\\u00a0</p>\"], \"sfpublishstatus\": [\"Online\"],       "sflastmodifiedbyid" : "00532000005IZovAAG",

      "rowid" : 5491848,

      "sfislatestversion" : "true",

      "sfpublishstatus" : "Online",
      "syssize" : 23137,
      "sysdate" : 1516189553000,
      "sflanguage" : "en_US",
      "sysparents" : "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"utf-16\"?><parents><parent name=\"Organization\" uri=\"https://na61.salesforce.com/home/home.jsp\" /><parent name=\"Best_Practice__ka\" uri=\"http://www.salesforce.com/org:organization/articletype:Best_Practice\" /><parent name=\"Coveo Voice of the Customer Breakfast at Dreamforce 2017\" uri=\"https://na61.salesforce.com/kA00d0000009ASq\" /></parents>",
      "sfdcexpandedarticletype" : "All;All|How To/Question",
      "sfcurrencyisocode" : "USD",
      "sfbestpracticekavid" : "ka00d0000009kUcAAI",
      "sfkbid" : "kA00d0000009ASqCAM",
      "sfdcexpandedproduct" : "All;All|Usage Analytics",
      "sfdetailsc" : "<h2 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Summary</b></h2>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">One Dreamforce morning, a group of like-minded folks gathered to have breakfast and talk about the challenges they are facing this coming year as it relates to introducing change within their contact centers as well as managing agent performance.  </b></p>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">The lively morning discussions were held by 18 different Coveo Customer Success &amp; Support Leaders supported by an eager group of Coveo note takers.</b></p>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">We hope all participants walked away with a renewed outlook on common agent proficiency challenges facing companies across industries, but more than understanding, we hope participants were also inspired with ideas regarding how to help your company solve these challenges.</b></p>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">We use these informative conversations to continuously improve our products and services to better meet your needs. Below you will find a recap of the questions we asked, as well as the common themes that emerged from those conversations. </b></p>\n\n<h2 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">The questions that started the conversations</b></h2>\n\n<ol><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<h3 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">How are you measuring agent adoption / proficiency?</b></h3>\n\t</li></ol>\n\n<ul style=\"margin-left: 80px;\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Scattered information storing is a common challenge facing companies across the board. To combat this, implement a cohesive KCS workflow structure - One customer who recently launched a KCS pilot is already seeing positive impacts through measuring:</b></p>\n\n\t<ul><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">AQI (Article Quality Index) which provides article confidence</b></p>\n\t\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Attachment rates (% of cases attached/associated to a support case)</b></p>\n\t\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">article reuse  (how often is an article being reused to solve a customer problem)</b></p>\n\t\t</li></ul>\n\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Operationally, businesses are measuring content relevancy by measuring:</b></p>\n\n\t<ul><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Click-throughs and click ranks.  </b></p>\n\t\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Time spent on a page or article</b></p>\n\t\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Engagement with site and content</b></p>\n\t\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Number of users</b></p>\n\t\t</li></ul>\n\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Measuring the impact agent performance has on business continues be a struggle for many. It’s recognized that we have to change and focus performance measurement on outcomes at the team level. However, change is hard. As an industry we’ve been focused on activity based measures for so long, that the shift continues to be a challenge for most.</b></p>\n\t</li></ul>\n\n<ol start=\"2\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<h3 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">How are you driving Adoption to increase agent time to proficiency?</b></h3>\n\t</li></ol>\n\n<ul style=\"margin-left: 80px;\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Working with agents all over of the world can make it a challenge to implement change and drive adoption of new technology, operational practices, and workflows for fear of missing objectives established by executives. (see point #1)</b></p>\n\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Be careful about the incentives you do set: warns one customer who set out a 100% attachment rate of KB articles to cases. The result - agents wanting to meet their performance objectives (which are often tied to financial incentives), were not always attaching relevant content to their cases.  This results in data integrity problems which defeats the whole purpose for linking cases &amp; articles.</b></p>\n\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Best Practice shows us that a link/attachment rate of 65%-80% is the industry benchmark.  This may fluctuate with product/service release cycles, as fewer knowledgebase articles are immediately available when a new product or service is released. </b></p>\n\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Agents have much stronger adoption rates when they understand how their individual or team contribution is impacting the overall customer experience and organizational goals. Best Practice is to create cascading goals from the top down that enable the agent to see a direct correlation in their behaviour to meeting the corporate objectives. </b></p>\n\t</li></ul>\n \n\n<ol start=\"3\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<h3 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">What metrics are you using to identify success signals and tell the story?</b></h3>\n\t</li></ol>\n\n<ul style=\"margin-left: 80px;\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Case Deflection, defined as the percentage of interactions that are taking place on a self-service community/portal that would have otherwise resulted in an assisted-service transaction in the contact center,  is the most common theme for measuring business outcomes. Coveo products have the ability to accurately measure trends. This has significantly reduced effort for many who were previously calculating this manually in spreadsheets.</b></p>\n\t</li><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Leaders also ask, “How strong is my content?”, “What am I missing?”  to track other signals. </b></p>\n\n\t<ul><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Measurement Best Practices include metrics like:<br>\t\ta) Case Deflection &amp; Self Service Success - Understanding that both are important measures, but that there is a difference.  Just because someone visits your portal, does not necessarily mean a case was deflected from an assisted service channel.  </b><br>\t\t<b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">b) Content Gaps &amp; Top Content - This data helps facilitate the need for increased alignment and collaboration on content creation, and sharing. The data helps everyone understand the importance of a solid content management strategy.</b><br>\t\t<b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">c) Cases - New vs Known.  Complete a study to analyze what percentage of the support cases coming into your assisted service channel get resolved with a known answer.  This is what the industry refers to as “new” vs “known”.  Understanding this will help you better identify how much “self-service” tools will be able to help.</b></p>\n\t\t</li></ul>\n\t</li></ul>\n\n<h2 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Themes</b></h2>\n\n<ol><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Relevant Content is critical.  Leading enterprises are still struggling to empower agents with the right information because of inefficient knowledge sharing across devices and sources. By identifying content usage metrics that will point your organization toward the most relevant content, and creating agent performance metrics (linked to organizational performance) to increase those metrics, businesses will be able to guide content creation activities for the benefit of all. </b></p>\n\t</li></ol>\n \n\n<ol start=\"2\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\"><a href=\"http://library.serviceinnovation.org/KCS_Kernel\" target=\"_blank\">KCS v6 (Knowledge Centered Service)</a> is an industry recognized best practice methodology. KCS was well known and being practiced by some, but was also very new to others. Coveo has the most KCS v6 certified employees of any organization, including several KCS Academy certified trainers who offer training and knowledge management related services for those interested in <a href=\"http://www.coveo.com/en/services/knowledge-management\" target=\"_blank\">learning more.</a></b></p>\n\t</li></ol>\n\n<ol start=\"3\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Improving agent metrics can be a long journey. Tieing adoption goals to overall business goals will guide a business’s path to success. Agents can be resistant to change when they can’t see the larger picture. Weaving temporary incentives that promote a customer-centric approach into agent workflow processes will help guide your entire organization towards the same goals. </b></p>\n\t</li></ol>\n\n<ol start=\"4\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">A Customer-Centric Experience is Holistic. </b></p>\n\t</li></ol>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\" style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">For a company to experience positive change, incentives can be woven into the companies’s culture. The Agent experience is one facet of the a comprehensive customer experience strategy - it’s can’t be treated in isolation. The self-service experience and agent experience now go hand in hand to deliver an overall Customer Experience.</b></p>\n\n<ol start=\"5\"><li dir=\"ltr\">\n\t<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Evaluate Messaging Capabilities to meet Customer Demands in Real Time </b></p>\n\t</li></ol>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\" style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">It’s crucial to consistently evaluate the new tools available to agents to ensure your meeting customer expectations while balancing current organizational goals.  Many are turning to chat as a cheaper, and more customer satisfying assisted service channel of operation.  However it important to recognize that even though agents love it, since it’s always on, there is a higher rate of agent burnout.  It was felt that the best practice was to rotate agents into a “chat” team for a period of time and then leverage other channel experiences - phone &amp; email to provide a balance.</b></p>\n \n\n<h2 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Additional Resources</b></h2>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\">Below are a few links to some additional readings and resources we thought you may also enjoy.</b></p>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\"><a href=\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/coveo-relevance-maturity-model\" target=\"_blank\">From Relevance Laggard to Leader: Becoming More Relevant to Your Customers, Communities and Staff</a></b></p>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\"><a href=\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/your-roadmap-to-intelligent-assisted-support\" target=\"_blank\">Your Roadmap to Intelligent Assisted Support</a> </b></p>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\"><a href=\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/the-state-of-knowledge-management-2014\" target=\"_blank\">TSIA Report: The Value of Unified Search in Customer Service</a></b></p>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\"><a href=\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/the-five-essential-steps-to-plan-your-CX-transformation-the-strategy-report\" target=\"_blank\">Forrester whitepaper: The Five Essential Steps To Plan Your CX Transformation </a></b></p>\n\n<h3 dir=\"ltr\"><b id=\"docs-internal-guid-b7e7ac33-c5c5-5988-4431-581cd62ccc88\"><a href=\"http://www.coveo.com/en/resources/ebooks-white-papers/forrester-research-brief-cognitive-search-is-ready-to-rev-up-your-enterprise\" target=\"_blank\">Forrester Research Brief: Cognitive Search Is Ready To Rev Up Your Enterprise&#39;s IQ</a></b></h3>\n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"> </p>\n \n\n<p dir=\"ltr\"> </p>",

Change to how reports/dashboards initiate processing\"], \"body__html_stripped\": [\"There is no way to stop a Coveo Report/Dashboard when it is processing.  when you open the report/dashboard it just starts running like a wild animal. Often it is chugging away getting data that the user DOES NOT NEED, but there is no way for the user to make it stop. The reports and dashboards should NOT RUN when they are first opened.  The reports/dashboards should also WAIT for the user to enter in all of the desired criteria and then the user should click something to specify that it is time to run the report and get the results. As it is currently, any change to most anything triggers an attempt to run the report, even if the user is not done entering in all of their criteria in all the fields. This is wasteful use of processing power and a bad user experience. Please consider making this change. \\n\"], \"sfcurrencyisocode\": [\"CAD\"], \"createdby.id\": [\"00532000004vQK7AAM\"], \"sfcreatorname\": [\"Ken Thomas\"], \"community.name\": [\"Coveo Community\"], \"contenttype\": [\"binarydata\"], \"sfismerged\": [false], \"createddate\": [1511879951], \"body\": [\"There is no way to stop a Coveo Report/Dashboard when it is processing.  when you open the report/dashboard it just starts running like a wild animal.       "sfbody" : "There is no way to stop a Coveo Report/Dashboard when it is processing.  when you open the report/dashboard it just starts running like a wild animal. Often it is chugging away getting data that the user DOES NOT NEED, but there is no way for the user to make it stop. The reports and dashboards should NOT RUN when they are first opened.  The reports/dashboards should also WAIT for the user to enter in all of the desired criteria and then the user should click something to specify that it is time to run the report and get the results. As it is currently, any change to most anything triggers an attempt to run the report, even if the user is not done entering in all of their criteria in all the fields. This is wasteful use of processing power and a bad user experience. Please consider making this change. \n",

(As folding happens after query time)\n \n\n It would be nice to adjust the total count so it could remain constant while navigating through result pages.\n \n\n The index returns the total count, but when you navigate through the pages, folding reorganize the results in clusters, which reduce/increase the total result. Searching for a word in those sections always retrieves all the results for that source, decreasing the relevancy. That is why we have some mechanisms available to remove those sections while indexing (Web scraping configuration for the web connector, Clean HTML in Sitecore...). However, not all developers/administrators know the existence of those mechanisms.\\n \\n\\n My idea is to analyze each source documents from time to time. Coveo could detect sections of text that is shared by multiple documents (at the start, at the end, or even in the middle of documents). When shared sections are discovered, a note could be available in the index UI to notify the users of the situation. Searching for a word in those sections always retrieves all the results for that source, decreasing the relevancy. That is why we have some mechanisms available to remove those sections while indexing (Web scraping configuration for the web connector, Clean HTML in Sitecore...). However, not all developers/administrators know the existence of those mechanisms.\\n \\n\\n My idea is to analyze each source documents from time to time. Coveo could detect sections of text that is shared by multiple documents (at the start, at the end, or even in the middle of documents). When shared sections are discovered, a note could be available in the index UI to notify the users of the situation. The note would also include a link to a documentation page explaining how to get rid of those shared sections for the specific connector used by the source.\\n\"], \"permanentid\": [\"b3a8d8f67c8d7775459b01800b1c9d5bd0afd7d7728811fb589a4e71a25f\"]}",

      "sfbody" : "When indexing a source, it often happens that most of the documents share some sections (header, footer...). Searching for a word in those sections always retrieves all the results for that source, decreasing the relevancy. That is why we have some mechanisms available to remove those sections while indexing (Web scraping configuration for the web connector, Clean HTML in Sitecore...). However, not all developers/administrators know the existence of those mechanisms.\n \n\n My idea is to analyze each source documents from time to time. Coveo could detect sections of text that is shared by multiple documents (at the start, at the end, or even in the middle of documents). When shared sections are discovered, a note could be available in the index UI to notify the users of the situation. The note would also include a link to a documentation page explaining how to get rid of those shared sections for the specific connector used by the source.\n",

Therefore, an ML\\u00a0drill can easily suggest documents that will be filtered out by the index. For example, when using ART, we want to boost 5 documents per query. However, if some documents are filtered out by the index, the user sees less suggestions.\\u00a0\\n \\n\\n The idea would be to ask Coveo ML\\u00a0for more suggestions (e.g. 20) and pass 20 QRE to the index, but telling the index to boost a maximum of 5 documents. The index could evaluate each QRE in order and stop processing the QRE when 5 documents match.\\n \\n\\n Advantages:\\n \\n\\n Most of the time, the right number of suggestions are returned.\\u00a0 The configuration of Coveo ML\\u00a0would be simpler in the Search API. We could remove the match query and match advanced query parameters. It would be easier to process in the query pipeline. No more disjonction queries.\\u00a0 UI development would be simpler.       "sfbody" : "Coveo ML does not know the filters applied to a query or the access rights of the user. Therefore, an ML drill can easily suggest documents that will be filtered out by the index. For example, when using ART, we want to boost 5 documents per query. However, if some documents are filtered out by the index, the user sees less suggestions. \n \n\n The idea would be to ask Coveo ML for more suggestions (e.g. 20) and pass 20 QRE to the index, but telling the index to boost a maximum of 5 documents. The index could evaluate each QRE in order and stop processing the QRE when 5 documents match.\n \n\n Advantages:\n \n\n Most of the time, the right number of suggestions are returned.  The configuration of Coveo ML would be simpler in the Search API. We could remove the match query and match advanced query parameters. It would be easier to process in the query pipeline. No more disjonction queries.  UI development would be simpler. No need to think about Coveo ML when defining the advanced query. It allows to support the security, which is required to use Coveo ML in a secure environment. The queries sent to the index would be simpler, i.e. no additional disjonction queries.",

Here are a couple of use cases:\\n \\n\\n Brocade, an SFDC customer, did something like this in order to store search preferences for particular users. Since they are in SFDC, we were able to leverage that infrastructure in order to build a table to store and recall saved search preferences for authenticated users which would be saved across browsers and cookie deletions.\\n \\n\\n Similarly, I built the GSA middleware server for Honeywell which allows them to push incremental content which is then added to Sitemap files for crawling by our Sitemap connector.       "sfbody" : "The main purpose of this would be to put some user-specific information onto the server, rather than just relying on browser cookies et al to maintain preferences. Here are a couple of use cases:\n \n\n Brocade, an SFDC customer, did something like this in order to store search preferences for particular users. Since they are in SFDC, we were able to leverage that infrastructure in order to build a table to store and recall saved search preferences for authenticated users which would be saved across browsers and cookie deletions.\n \n\n Similarly, I built the GSA middleware server for Honeywell which allows them to push incremental content which is then added to Sitemap files for crawling by our Sitemap connector. In order to allow new content to be added cleanly, I had to stand up a database for maintaining state, i.e. incremental content is fed into the database, and then my script generates new Sitemap files from the database, rather than trying to dynamically edit the Sitemap files in situ. \n \n Clearly, SFDC customers have access to a back-end that they can use for this sort of thing. And perhaps there's something similarly accessible for Sitecore customers who want a partner database available to do these sorts of data manipulations. However, for everyone else, it'll be a different custom configuration, and I think it would be a nice value-add to have a consistent option that is natively supported by other elements of Coveo which would allow us to build and leverage standard tools.\n",

This \\\"WARNING\\\" will contain all the necessary information to know what the problem is (401 unauthorized). However, since the security cache is triggering failed login attempts, and retrying when it's not able to, the Salesforce server will return an enormous quantity of failed login attempts errors if it's monitored. With some clients, it can even cause some performance issues. Also, the update will eventually end without having updated any security whatsoever because it never had access to the server. All this, without any means to receive an email alert from Coveo to know something's wrong.\"], \"lastmodifiedby.attribute.type\": [\"User\"], \"createdby.createddate_fiscalmonth\": [7], \"sfcommunityname\": [\"Coveo Community\"], \"coveo_url\": [\"https://na61.salesforce.com/08732000000D09hAAC\"], \"sfcreatedbyname\": [\"Eric Savoie\"], \"objecttypelabel\": [\"Idea\"], \"sfcommunityid\": [\"09a32000000XhryAAC\"], \"sfstatus\": [\"Submitted\"], \"ismerged\": [false], \"createdby.createddate__fiscal_month\": [7], \"coveo_connector_hasbinarydata\": [false], \"categories\": [\"Coveo Platform\"], \"lastmodifiedby.attribute.url\": [\"/services/data/v34.0/sobjects/User/00560000003FMKhAAO\"], \"lastmodifiedby.createddate_fiscalmonth\": [7], \"sfvotescore\": [1.90869966574232e-31], \"sfcreatorfullphotourl\": [\"https://c.na61.content.force.com/profilephoto/72960000000LuMU/F\"], \"clickableuri\": [\"https://na61.salesforce.com/08732000000D09hAAC\"], \"coveo_record_size\": [2], \"sftitle\": [\"Security cache unable to connect should display an \\\"ERROR\\\" in the logs\"], \"body__html_stripped\": [\"Currently, if the security cache is unable to connect to Salesforce because of bad credentials, it will only display a \\\"WARNING\\\"\\u00a0in the logs. This \\\"WARNING\\\" will contain all the necessary information to know what the problem is (401 unauthorized). However, since the security cache is triggering failed login attempts, and retrying when it's not able to, the Salesforce server will return an enormous quantity of failed login attempts errors if it's monitored. With some clients, it can even cause some performance issues. Also, the update will eventually end without having updated any security whatsoever because it never had access to the server. All this, without any means to receive an email alert from Coveo to know something's wrong.\\n \\n\\n We believe the kind of problem should at least trigger an \\\"ERROR\\\"\\u00a0in the logs in order to be easily traceable and eligible to email alerts. It could even go as far as preventing the security cache from updating. However this kind of behavior would probably be more realistic if we could update each security providers separately.\\n\"], \"sfcurrencyisocode\": [\"USD\"], \"createdby.id\": [\"00560000003FMKhAAO\"], \"sfcreatorname\": [\"Eric Savoie\"], \"community.name\": [\"Coveo Community\"], \"contenttype\": [\"binarydata\"], \"sfismerged\": [false], \"lastmodifiedby.createddate_fiscalquarter\": [2], \"createddate\": [1499979696], \"body\": [\"Currently, if the security cache is unable to connect to Salesforce because of bad credentials, it will only display a \\\"WARNING\\\"\\u00a0in the logs. This \\\"WARNING\\\" will contain all the necessary information to know what the problem is (401 unauthorized). However, since the security cache is triggering failed login attempts, and retrying when it's not able to, the Salesforce server will return an enormous quantity of failed login attempts errors if it's monitored. With some clients, it can even cause some performance issues. Also, the update will eventually end without having updated any security whatsoever because it never had access to the server. All this, without any means to receive an email alert from Coveo to know something's wrong.\\n \\n\\n We believe the kind of problem should at least trigger an \\\"ERROR\\\"\\u00a0in the logs in order to be easily traceable and eligible to email alerts. It could even go as far as preventing the security cache from updating. However this kind of behavior would probably be more realistic if we could update each security providers separately.\\n\"], \"sfcreatedbyid\": [\"00560000003FMKhAAO\"], \"community.attribute.type\": [\"Community\"], \"sfbody\": [\"Currently, if the security cache is unable to connect to Salesforce because of bad credentials, it will only display a \\\"WARNING\\\"\\u00a0in the logs. This \\\"WARNING\\\" will contain all the necessary information to know what the problem is (401 unauthorized). However, since the security cache is triggering failed login attempts, and retrying when it's not able to, the Salesforce server will return an enormous quantity of failed login attempts errors if it's monitored. With some clients, it can even cause some performance issues. Also, the update will eventually end without having updated any security whatsoever because it never had access to the server. All this, without any means to receive an email alert from Coveo to know something's wrong.\\n \\n\\n We believe the kind of problem should at least trigger an \\\"ERROR\\\"\\u00a0in the logs in order to be easily traceable and eligible to email alerts. It could even go as far as preventing the security cache from updating. However this kind of behavior would probably be more realistic if we could update each security providers separately.\\n\"], \"permanentid\": [\"37630bcf88e984f6953bf8223d7d2cbf74b2500671027e57c8aadeb8cbb9\"]}",

      "sflastmodifiedbyname" : "Eric Savoie",
      "collection" : "default",
      "syssourcetype" : "Salesforce",
      "sfbody" : "Currently, if the security cache is unable to connect to Salesforce because of bad credentials, it will only display a \"WARNING\" in the logs. This \"WARNING\" will contain all the necessary information to know what the problem is (401 unauthorized). However, since the security cache is triggering failed login attempts, and retrying when it's not able to, the Salesforce server will return an enormous quantity of failed login attempts errors if it's monitored. With some clients, it can even cause some performance issues. Also, the update will eventually end without having updated any security whatsoever because it never had access to the server. All this, without any means to receive an email alert from Coveo to know something's wrong.\n \n\n We believe the kind of problem should at least trigger an \"ERROR\" in the logs in order to be easily traceable and eligible to email alerts. It could even go as far as preventing the security cache from updating. However this kind of behavior would probably be more realistic if we could update each security providers separately.\n",

When they don't receive an email, end users open cases and complain about our service.\n \n\n If I understand correctly, we only trigger source errors for Salesforce sources and only for 2 types of Error: SALESFORCE_UNABLE_TO_CONNECT and SALESFORCE_QUERY_TIMEOUT? Maybe we should update the \"receive error notification\" message in the admin tool setup to reflect reality?\n \n\n  \n \n\n I would rather spam email boxes and tell users that they were warned through email of their source in error, rather than hear back from a customer who's production source was not updated for a month because he did not get an email to contact support due to his source being in error.\n",

so just getting an authentication failure when permissions are not set right is not as helpful as it could be. For Coveo-internal folks, this isn't a big deal as we learn which options are necessary and where to find that information when we do certain tasks over and over again, but for a client who may have to do a task once or twice, finding just the right permission without having to search and then follow a series of links through as many documents might be quite welcome. \\n \\n Specifically, I think it would be great if the authentication error could clarify:\\n \\n\\n \\u00a0\\n \\n\\n - If an API key has the wrong permissions, it should specify which permission might be selected for the key in question.\\n \\n\\n - I understand the the following could conceivably be used to facilitate a brute-force attack, so they may not be a good idea from a security perspective, but if there's a safe way to do it, it'd be nice to have the error message report...\\n \\n\\n \\u00a0 +\\u00a0If an API key being used has been deleted.\\n \\n\\n \\u00a0 + \\u00a0If an API key being used has been disabled.\\n\"], \"sfcurrencyisocode\": [\"USD\"], \"createdby.id\": [\"00560000003FMKhAAO\"], \"sfcreatorname\": [\"Eric Savoie\"], \"community.name\": [\"Coveo Community\"], \"contenttype\": [\"binarydata\"], \"lastcommentdate\": [1499891947], \"sfismerged\": [false], \"lastmodifiedby.createddate_fiscalquarter\": [2], \"createddate\": [1499890758], \"body\": [\"Hi Team,\\n \\n\\n The API keys have a wide range of permissions options in Cloud V2, so just getting an authentication failure when permissions are not set right is not as helpful as it could be. This is a very useful feature, so that the content browser can be used against one single pipeline to investigate issues in that pipeline. This functionality needs some improvement. There is no way to visually tell what pipeline is being used while you are in the content browser. That should be added, so that when a single pipeline is at play, the user will be able to tell which one it is. In addition, the user should not have to go to the list of pipelines on another page in order to switch the content browser to a different pipeline. \"objecttypelabelplural\": [\"Ideas\"], \"coveo_record_size\": [2], \"sftitle\": [\"Improve Wildcard Functionality\"], \"body__html_stripped\": [\"This article\\u00a0 https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/SupportKB/What%27s+Happening+Behind+the+Scenes+When+You+Use+a+Wildcard \\u00a0explains the complication of wildcards and why often times the wildcard search will not find the expected results. The Coveo search experience could be improved to help regular users understand why their search with wildcards is not giving them the answers that they know exist, which are not found at all by the wildcard search. To begin with, when a wildcard search is done, the search should warn the user if it is known that all the matching results are not going to be in the results.This can be done by counting the matching items in the lexicon for the wildcard, and displaying that number with a warning and a call to action. Perhaps count up to 100 or 1000, or whatever has an acceptable performance impact and then display the information on the screen above the search results. EXAMPLE: We found over 1,000 matching items for abc* with over 987,xxx results. For performance reasons, we are unable to show you all these results. Please perform a more exact wildcard search or review the following list of sorted matches and select the ones you wish to include in your search. The user would then: 1. be\\u00a0made aware of the issue with the results of the wildcard search and 2. have two options to get better results, re-run a more exact search or review a well-sorted pop up of the matching items and pick and choose the ones of interest. This would make the wild card search much more intuitive and the end user would have a chance of finding the correct results with Coveo search.\"], \"sfcurrencyisocode\": [\"CAD\"], \"createdby.id\": [\"00532000004vWWnAAM\"], \"sfcreatorname\": [\"Greg Laporte\"], \"community.name\": [\"Coveo Community\"], \"contenttype\": [\"binarydata\"], \"sfismerged\": [false], \"createddate\": [1498866750], \"body\": [\"This article\\u00a0 https://developers.coveo.com/display/public/SupportKB/What%27s+Happening+Behind+the+Scenes+When+You+Use+a+Wildcard \\u00a0explains the complication of wildcards and why often times the wildcard search will not find the expected results. The Coveo search experience could be improved to help regular users understand why their search with wildcards is not giving them the answers that they know exist, which are not found at all by the wildcard search. To begin with, when a wildcard search is done, the search should warn the user if it is known that all the matching results are not going to be in the results.This can be done by counting the matching items in the lexicon for the wildcard, and displaying that number with a warning and a call to action. Perhaps count up to 100 or 1000, or whatever has an acceptable performance impact and then display the information on the screen above the search results. The Coveo search experience could be improved to help regular users understand why their search with wildcards is not giving them the answers that they know exist, which are not found at all by the wildcard search. To begin with, when a wildcard search is done, the search should warn the user if it is known that all the matching results are not going to be in the results.This can be done by counting the matching items in the lexicon for the wildcard, and displaying that number with a warning and a call to action. Perhaps count up to 100 or 1000, or whatever has an acceptable performance impact and then display the information on the screen above the search results. EXAMPLE: We found over 1,000 matching items for abc* with over 987,xxx results. For performance reasons, we are unable to show you all these results. Please perform a more exact wildcard search or review the following list of sorted matches and select the ones you wish to include in your search. The Coveo search experience could be improved to help regular users understand why their search with wildcards is not giving them the answers that they know exist, which are not found at all by the wildcard search. To begin with, when a wildcard search is done, the search should warn the user if it is known that all the matching results are not going to be in the results.This can be done by counting the matching items in the lexicon for the wildcard, and displaying that number with a warning and a call to action. The user would then: 1. be made aware of the issue with the results of the wildcard search and 2. have two options to get better results, re-run a more exact search or review a well-sorted pop up of the matching items and pick and choose the ones of interest. This would make the wild card search much more intuitive and the end user would have a chance of finding the correct results with Coveo search.",
